loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Ana Cristina es socia del Banco Comunal “24 de Junio”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 50 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 3 hijos, estudio educación secundaria completa, vive en la Parcialidad de Alinsuyo Ilave.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, hace varios años es una de las socias fundadoras,  su préstamo inicial fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invirtió en la compra de ganado ovino. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado mayor, la señora Ana Cristina también se dedica a la chacra.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando para darles una educación a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan las charlas y los ahorros
texts.en:
Ms. Ana Cristina is a member of the "24 de Junio" Community Bank, which is located in the Ilave district, Province of El Collao, Puno state. She is 50 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She finished high school and lives in Parcialidad de Alinsuyo Ilave.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos association for several years and is one of the founding members. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she invested in the purchase of sheeps.

At this time she applied for a loan of $525 for the purchase of cows. Mrs. Ana Cristina is also active in the farm field.

Her desire is to keep working to give an education to children. She likes the speeches and savings

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Francisco Rene

texts.es: Francisco René M. M. tiene 64 años, tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000, por lo que es un buen cliente y también un hombre muy responsable. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que dio inicio desde muy joven ya que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificios ha logrado tener lo necesario. Ahora el está solicitando un financiamiento para capital de trabajo y así comprar los productos necesarios. Su mayor sueño es seguir con esta actividad y obtener su propio ingreso para sufragar los gastos personales y cumplir con su responsabilidad.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Olaga Viviana

texts.es:
La señora Viviana es socia del Banco Comunal “24 de Junio”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 30 años de edad, estado civil conviviente y madre de 1 hija, estudio educación secundaria completa, vive en el Barrio Pueblo Libre de Ilave.

La señora Inicia su trabajo con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, con un préstamo inicial fue de  S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra de lana sintética de colores para la elaboración de artesanías, como fajas, fajillas, trencillas, etc.

Su deseo es obtener mayor capital para agrandar su negocio.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Viviana is a member of the "24 de Junio" Community Bank, which is located in the district of Ilave, Province of El Collao, Puno State. She is 30 years old, has a daughter and lives with her partner. She finished High School and lives in the Pueblo Libre de Ilave neighborhood.

Mrs. Viviana started working with Manuela Ramos association, with an initial loan of 500 nuevos soles, which she invested in the purchase of wool and synthetic colors for the making of handicrafts, such as belts, corset, braids, etc.

Her desire is to obtain more capital to grow her business. She likes the terms of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal “24 de Junio”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 38 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 2 hijos, estudio educación primaria completa, vive en el Barrio Pueblo Libre en la Av. Pacifico 274.


La señora Inicia su trabajo con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, con un préstamo inicial fue de  S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra de lana sintética y de alpaca de diferentes colores para la elaboración de artesanías, como fajas, fajillas, trencillas, llijllas, etc.

Su deseo es agrandar su negocio para poder educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y las facilidades en los préstamos
texts.en:
Sra. Teresa is a member of the Communal Bank “24 de Junio” (June 24), which is located in the District of Ilave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 38 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. Sra. Teresa has an elementary school education and lives in the neighborhood of Pueblo Libre on Av. Pacifico 274.

She just started working with Manuela Ramos. With this initial loan of 500 soles, she will buy synthetic and alpaca wool in different colors for making handicrafts such as belts, tassels, braids, llijllas (brightly colored cloths), etc.

Sra. Teresa hopes to expand her business so that she can educate her children. She enjoys her Communal Bank meetings and the convenience of her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase synthetic and alpaca wool in different colors

loans.name: Benedicta Irma

texts.es:
La Sra. Benedicta Irma M. es soltera, tiene 2 hijos los cuales acuden a la escuela de la zona, viven en una casa propia la cual estan terminando de construir.

La Sra. Benedicta se dedica a la actividad lechera desde hace 15 años, entrega diariamente toda su produccion a una empresa que produce toda clase de productos lacteos. 

esta oportunidad no la quieren desaprovechar debido a que requieren dinero para terminar de construir su vivienda y mejorar la condicion de vida para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Benedicta Irma M. is single and has 2 children who attend school in the area. They live in their own home, which is in the final stage of construction.

Sra. Benedicta has been a dairy farmer for 15 years. She delivers milk on a daily basis to a company that produces all types of dairy products.

She did not want to miss this opportunity to take advantage of a loan, so she will use the money to finish construction of her house so that she can improve the living conditions for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish construction of her house

loans.name: Juana Jeannette

texts.es: Juana Jeannette U. Cortez tiene 35 años de edad. Su actividad económica es una pulpería. Ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con fundación león 2000 y es una mujer my responsable, además siempre le ha gustado trabajar. Ella se levanta muy temprano todos los días, ya que tiene que atender a sus 4 hijos por lo que siempre tiene que estar pendientes de ellos, por lo que siempre ha invertido el financiamiento en capital de trabajo y en base a mucho trabajo ha logrado obtener este negocio. Actualmente solicita un financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, aceite, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, jabón y detergentes. Humildemente solamente sueña con seguir aumentando con productos su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana Jeannette U. Cortez is 35 years old. She runs a local store. She has worked with Fundación León 2000 for a long time and is a very responsible woman who has always enjoyed working. She gets up very early every day so that she can look after her 4 children, for whom she must care at all times. It is for them that she has always invested in so much hard work and through her hard work, she has obtained this business. She is asking for this loan so that she will have enough capital to buy inventory such as candy, oil, beans, rice, sugar, soap and detergent. She humbly dreams only of continuing to expand her business with more store products.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase store inventory: candy, oil, beans, rice, sugar, soap, etc

loans.name: Elena Guillermina

texts.en:
Elena, a member of the United Friends village bank, is 51 years old, married and the mother of three children, ages 33, 25, and 18 years. They all live with her and the youngest studies at an institute.

Elena studied secretarial work but did not practice because she got a job in a tailor’s workshop and during the evenings she used to sell “salchipapas” (hot dogs and french fries) in the street. She worked like that for many years but had to stop because she arrived home late and it was very dangerous. Fortunately, her husband got a good job and she was able to stop selling salchipapas. Currently, Elena makes her living caring for two girls everyday until 4 p.m.

Since joining FINCA, the loans have helped her to be able to give an education to her children as well as contribute to the household in a way that makes her feel useful. Elena now needs a loan of 3000 soles to finish building the place that she is going to rent. Her dream is to start a juice shop in her house.

loans.use: To finish building the place that she is going to rent

loans.name: Sonia Violeta

texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the United Friends village bank. She is 52 years-old, married, and has two children who are 22 and 21 years old and live with her. The eldest child works while the youngest studies at university.

Sonia has a food stand in the market that was an inheritance from her mother-in-law. Sonia and her husband both work there serving breakfasts, lunches, and dinners everyday until 7 p.m.

Since joining FINCA, Sonia’s business has improved and her sales have grown, which has allowed her to buy even more merchandise. She needs a loan of 2,600 soles to buy rice, sugar, meat, and beans. Her dream is to move her restaurant to a bigger location.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients

loans.name: Yuli Martha

texts.en:
Yuli is a member of the United Friends village bank. She is 48 years-old and has three children. The youngest is 15 years old, lives with her, and studies at the public school.

Yuli’s husband has always worked in a curtain tailoring business while Yuli took care of her children. Now that her children are grown, she has decided to start working with her husband in curtain tailoring.

Since joining FINCA, Yuli has been able to save and invest and begin to grow her business. She has bought a sewing machine, and with time she will buy another.

Yuli needs a loan of 1,600 soles to buy a machine for her curtains. Her dream is to have her own workshop because she is currently working out of her in-laws’ workshop.

loans.use: To buy a machine for her curtains

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
When Maria’s daughter was two years old and ready to start daycare, Maria decided to start her own day care center in order to provide a high-quality learning environment for her daughter, as well as other children in her community.  She started “Kids Place 2 Explore and Learn” two years ago and since then has transformed her home into a learning facility for six children from two to five years old.

When she started her daycare, Maria had trouble getting a small business loan from a bank. “They didn’t see my home daycare as a business, and I needed a very small amount of money,” she says.  She is grateful for a loan from Opportunity Fund and Kiva, which will allow her to purchase what she needs for her facility without the stress of high interest rate credit cards, the only other source of financing available to her. 

Maria needs a loan to purchase cubbies and bookshelves, portable cribs, educational toys and books, and new flooring. These supplies are essential to Maria’s business to keep her enrollment up, since parents look for the quality of materials, furniture, and toys when selecting a daycare.  

Maria is proud of the success of her business and that her enrollment is at capacity for the space she has. She is happy when the children, at first reluctant to leave their parents, begin to see her home as an enjoyable place to spend the day. In the future, Maria would like to move her daycare from her home to an off-site location where she would have the capacity to grow. Currently she employs one part-time and one full-time assistant, and would like to hire more people and enroll more children.

Learn more at http://kidsplace2exploreandlearn.com/ABOUT_ME.php.

loans.use: To buy cubbies and bookshelves, portable cribs, educational toys and books, and new flooring for a daycare center

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es:
Marianela tiene 31 años de edad, es casada, y vive junto a su esposo y su hija de 3 años de edad en el pueblo joven 9 de Octubre de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace dos años y medio es propietaria de una bodega – bazar en la que vende útiles escolares y artículos de uso personal; las ganancias de este negocio le ayudan a solventar los gastos económicos de su familia, ya que su esposo trabaja como transportista y lo que percibe a diario no les basta para mantener su hogar.

Ella está solicitando a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1100 nuevos soles que desea invertir en la ampliación de su negocio con la compra de abarrotes y golosinas para luego ofrecersérselas a sus clientes.

Su más grande anhelo es convertir su negocio en una librería ya que no existe un establecimiento parecido en la zona y de esa manera ayudar a los estudiantes de su localidad.

Marianela ya ha trabajado con nosotros anteriormente y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos razón por la que es considerada como una cliente excelente.
texts.en:
Marianela is a 31-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and her 3-year-old daughter in the city of Chiclayo. For the past two and a half years she has been the owner of a warehouse – a store that sells school supplies and personal items; the income from this business helps her to cover the costs her family incurs. Even though her husband works as a driver, what he receives daily is not enough to support the household. She is requesting a loan of 1100 soles to invest in the expansion of her business with the purchase of groceries and sweets to sell to her customers. Her greatest wish is to eventually convert her business into a bookshop since right now there isn’t one in her area and in this way she could help local students. Marianela has worked with the partner organization before and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with her payments and for this reason is considered an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase groceries and sweets in order to expand her business

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.en:
María is a member of the United Friends village bank. She is 50 years-old, married, and has two children who are 22 and 20 years-old. Both of them study at an institute.

Maria started studying law at university but stopped when she got married. Since her children finished studying high school, she decided to return to her studies at the university. She is succeeding with the support of her husband. She also started a video, photos, and film store that her husband manages. Since joining FINCA she has learned to save and wisely invest her loans.

María needs a loan of 1,000 soles to buy videos and film rolls for cameras. Her dream is to start a spa and beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy videos and film rolls for cameras

loans.name: Mirtha Teresa

texts.en:
Mirtha is a member of the United Friends village bank. 
She is 44 years-old, married, and has two children who are 18 and 15 years-old. The eldest child studies at an institute while the youngest studies at the public school. 
Mirtha began working in a retail shop as a salesperson. She worked there for many years but had to quit that job because her mother, who was caring for her children, got cancer and passed away. Shortly after, she started working out of her house, selling groceries like rice, sugar, milk, noodles in a cart. Her business grew until she was able to convert part of her house into a convenience store. Since joining FINCA, her business has improved and she has a variety of merchandise. 
Mirtha needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy rice, sugar, detergent, and cases of beer. Her dream is to sell beer wholesale.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, detergent, and cases of beer.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Previous loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=97764&_tpos=f&_tpg=h

Luisa is a member of the United Friends village bank. She is 50 years old, married, and has three adult children who work. Luisa continues to bring footwear and clothes from Trujillo, in the north of Peru. She only brings orders she has received in Lima. The construction of her house has been successfully finished. However, she still needs to put some finishing touches on it. She rents out part of her house while she lives in the other part with her family. Luisa needs a loan of 1,600 soles to buy leather shoes and sandals. Her dream is to have a stand to sell shoes.

loans.use: To buy leather shoes and sandals

loans.name: Gloria Ysabel

texts.en: Gloria is a member of the United Friends village bank. She is 47 years old, married, and has two children who are 15 and 12. They both study at the public school. Gloria studied baking at the Institute of Maria Auxiliadora for five years and worked for some time after that. Next, she decided to sell anticuchos (a Peruvian beef delicacy) and fried chicken out of the front door of her house. Since joining FINCA Peru, Gloria has learned to save and invest, and she says her economic situation is better thanks to FINCA. Gloria needs a loan of 1,000 soles to buy ice cream, flour, oil, and chickens. Her dream is to repair her house so that she can use her living room to sell her fried chicken.

loans.use: To buy ice cream, flour, oil, and chickens

loans.name: Maria Leonor

texts.en:
Previous loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=97760&_tpos=f&_tpg=h
María is a member of the United Friends village bank. 
She is 47 years-old, separated, and has four sons. Her three oldest are married and her youngest studies at the public school. 
María sells clothes, shoes, and now is selling school supplies as well because that’s what her clients have been requesting. Also, in the mornings she works at a restaurant helping to cook. 
María needs a new loan of 1200 soles to buy school supplies and more clothing and shoes merchandise. Her dream is to have her own stand in the market.

loans.use: buy school supplies and more clothing and shoes merchandise

loans.name: Patricia Soledad

texts.en: Patricia is a member of the United Friends village bank. She is 40 years old, married, and has two children who are 13 and 4. Both are studying at the public school. Patricia studied cosmetology and goes to her clients’ houses when they require haircuts, hairstyling, and hair dying. She also works with her husband at their carpenter’s workshop at a rented space. She learned to sand the wood and fulfill some orders from customers. Since joining FINCA Peru, the loans have helped Patricia a lot because she is able to buy more merchandise and take more purchase orders. Patricia needs a loan of 1,200 soles to buy oak wood and pressure-treated wood. Her dream is that her business will grow so she can continue to give an education to her children.

loans.use: To buy oak wood and pressure-treated wood

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es:
El señor Herminio M. es padre de familia, tiene una hija adolescente que actualmente estudia.
Con dos créditos anteriores con FVP ha construido un cuarto, pero le falta colocarle el techo. Tiene el proyecto de construir una losa de concreto, para que la casa sea más segura y duradera.
El está solicitando un préstamo para esa construcción y planean pagarlos con los ingresos que obtienen el como albañil (construcción y reparación de casa) y el de su esposa la señora Teodora Bautista que trabaja como ayudante de cocinera en una escuela, estos son los ingresos con el cual pagaran el crédito.
Su deseo es que su hija tenga su propio cuarto y viva mejor.
texts.en:
Herminio is the father of an adolescent daughter who is currently studying. The past two loans he had with FVP was used to construct a room in his house, but one that lacks a roof. He has a plan to construct a concrete slab so that the house can be safer and more durable.

He is requesting a loan for this construction and plans to use the income he makes as a builder (constructing and repairing houses) and that of his wife, Teodora, who works as a kitchen assistant at a school, to pay off his loan.

His wish is for his daughter to have her own room and to have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to put a concrete slab in the ground floor of his home

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es:
Abraham tiene 37 años, es un hombre muy laborioso, vive con su pareja y madre de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Trabaja como operario podando y fumigando las plantas de frutos cítricas en un fundo de su región, esta labor la realiza de lunes a viernes, de 7 de la mañana a 5 de la tarde. Pero los fines de semana, aprovecha en cultivar, podar y fumigar sus propias plantas de naranjas y plátanos. Cuando sus productos están maduros su esposa va recolectando y acumulándolos en su casa para ir vendiéndolos a los compradores mayoristas, quienes le ofrecen precios muy satisfactorios. Por tal motivo Abraham valora mucho sus cultivos, por ello está planeando comprar más terrenos, para que de ese modo, en el futuro sus hijos no sufran de necesidades económicas.
Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, él es muy puntual en sus pagos y en las reuniones, ya que en su banco comunal se siente muy contento con todos. El dinero que viene solicitando lo piensa invertir en la compra de 500 plantas de cítricos para incrementar su producción.

loans.use: Compra de plantas de frutas cítricas

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
Cristian tiene 30 años, vive con su pareja y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Trabaja como operario en un fundo llamado “Carrión” y es el mejor tractorista (conduce el tractor), ya que tiene buen manejo y agallas para subir por los cerros más empinados sin dificultad alguna. Por ello, su patrón le tiene mucha confianza y eso lo motiva a esforzarse cada vez más en su trabajo. Sin embargo, tampoco se siente seguro de ser dependiente, por lo que en acuerdo y apoyo de su esposa, hace 3 años empezaron a sembrar sus propios frutos cítricos (naranjas y mandarinas). La próxima temporada de verano en la ciudad de Lima (de enero a marzo) planea enviar todas sus cosechas y de ese modo espera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus pequeños hijos que son su adoración.
Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y durante los anteriores periodos no ha tenido problemas de pago. Las veces que no puede asistir a las reuniones de su banco comunal, lo hace su esposa, ya que no le gustaría perder la oportunidad de próximos créditos. Ahora, con el dinero solicitado piensa invertir en la compra de abonos e insecticidas para sus cítricos.
texts.en:
Cristian is 30 years old and lives with his partner and two children in a house that they own. He works as an operator at a farm called “Carrión” and is the best tractor driver because he has the guts to climb the steepest hills without any difficulty. His boss has a lot of confidence in him and this motivates him to make an effort every time he’s at work. However, he does not want to feel that he is dependent on his work, so for the past three years with the support of his wife he began to sow his own citrus plants (oranges and mandarins). The next summer season (from January to March) he plans to send his harvest to Lima in order to improve the quality of life for him and his small children, who he adores.

This is his third loan with MFP and in the past periods he has not had any problems with his payments. The times when he could not attend his Village Bank meetings his wife went for him since they did not want to lose the opportunity of getting future loans. Now, the money he requests will be invested in the purchase of fertilizers and insecticides for his citruses.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Edubeges

texts.es:
Edubeges tiene 35 años, es una madre muy cariñosa de 4 hijos, vive felizmente casada en su casa propia. Después de sus labores en el hogar acude a las 8 de la mañana a sus chacras de cítricos (naranjas, mandarinas y limones), las cuales se esmera en tenerlas limpias y sobre todo fumigadas para evitar que los mosquitos afecten sus frutos y sean cotizados a un buen precio. En su caso los compradores van hasta su chacra y ella les vende el ciento de fruta a 3 ó 4 soles. Pero en los meses de enero a febrero son muy demandadas en la ciudad de Lima, por lo que aprovecha en venderlas hasta 10 soles el ciento. Por tal motivo acaba de abonar sus plantas para cosechar en la temporada de verano para reunir mayores ganancias que solventen sus necesidades. Pero mientras espera su cosecha trabaja como operaria junto a su esposo en otras chacras, de ese modo sus hijos no pasan carencias económicas.
Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y ya está predispuesta para pagar todas sus cuotas de acuerdo a su cronograma, pues no quiere hacer quedar mal a sus compañeros que la garantizaron. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cosechas del mes de enero.
texts.en:
Edubeges is 35 years old. She is a very loving mother of 4 children and lives happily married in her own home. After her morning household chores, she goes at 8 a.m. to her small citrus farm, where she grows oranges, mandarins and limes. She keeps her orchard painstakingly clean, and above all fumigated, so that her fruit will not be damaged by insects and can be sold at a good price. Buyers come directly to her orchard, and she sells them a hundred pieces of fruit for 3 or 4 Peruvian soles. However, in the months of January and February, fruit is in great demand in the city of Lima, so she can take advantage of this situation and sell her products at up to 10 soles per hundred. For this reason, she has recently fertilized her trees to prepare for a harvest in the [Southern] summer season, which will bring higher profits and help her cover her family's needs. In addition, while she is waiting for the harvest, she and her husband work as laborers on other farms, so that their children do not suffer from economic hardships. This is Edubeges' first loan with MFP, and she is prepared to make all of her payments on schedule, since she does not want to cause problems for the other members who have guaranteed them. She will invest the funds she is requesting to purchase chemical fertilizers for her harvest in the month of January.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia González esta agradecida por que se le otorgo un crédito en esta institución el cual pudo realizar una parte de su proyecto. Ahora esta protegida ya que la barda que construyo la hizo alta, pero en este momento requiere el préstamo para enjarrarla para que se vea bien.
Cecilia es una joven soltera que piensa en el futuro, seguridad de su casa tanto como de ella. La joven trabaja en un banco como cajera y con estos ingresos pagara el préstamo otorgado.
texts.en:
Cecilia González is grateful for the loan she was given in this institution. She was able to complete part of her project with the loan. Now she is protected because the wall she built is tall. But, now she needs a loan to stucco it so that it looks good. Cecilia is a young single woman who thinks of the future security of her house as well as her own safety. She works in a bank as a cashier. She will use this income to pay for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stucco the wall

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un joven de 23 años, está separado, vive en la casa de sus padres y tiene una hija que vive con su madre (ex pareja). Labrar y sembrar sus terrenos es una actividad placentera y regocijante para él, en sus chacras de zona sierra siembra papa, mientras que en la selva naranjas y mandarinas, pues la localidad donde vive tiene de ambas regiones. Para cultivar buenos productos, tales como los que nos muestra en la foto, presta toda su atención en remover, abonar y fumigar oportunamente sus tierras para que sus productos tengan muy buena calidad y no le discutan los precios en el mercado de mayoristas de la ciudad. Pues así tiene la seguridad de ofertar sus productos y la mayoría de las veces gana en calidad a otros agricultores. Su deseo a futuro es incrementar su producción para que las ganancias le permitan comprar un carro para transportar sus cargas hasta los diversos mercados.
Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y se siente muy comprometido con su banco comunal, por ello renueva su compromisos de puntualidad en sus pagos, ya que este crédito es de mucha importancia para él. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos y funguicidas para sus chacras de papa.
texts.en:
Juan is a 23 year old young man. He is separated, and he lives in his parents' house. He has a daughter who lives with her mother (his ex significant other). Working and planting his fields is a pleasant and delightful activity for him. He plants potatoes on his farm in the mountain region, and he plants oranges and tangerines in the jungle. The place where he lives has both regions. To cultivate good products like the ones in the photo, you need to give all of your attention to turning over, fertilizing, and fumigating the land at the right time so that you products are good quality. Then you don’t argue over prices in the city’s wholesale market. That way he has the certainty of selling his products, and most of the time he has better quality products than the other growers. His wish for the future is to increase his production so that his earnings will allow him to buy a car to transport his products to the different markets. This is his second loan with MFP. He feels very committed to his communal bank. He renews his promise to make his payments punctually. This loan is very important to him. The money he is now asking for is to buy chemical fertilizers and fungicides for his potato crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo tiene 62 años, está separado de la madre de sus 2 hijos y vive en su casa propia. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a sus cultivos de naranja, café y plátanos; pero de todas sus siembras la más rentable ha sido el café, ya que hubo temporadas donde la mayoría de los agricultores no cosecharon buen café, pero él sí, entonces logró venderlo a un muy buen precio. Esas ganancias le sirvieron para comprar su terreno y construir una casa en la ciudad de Lima, pero con la separación de su esposa, él regresó a su casa rural en su pueblo, concentrando sus esfuerzos en sus cultivos de café. Aunque algunas veces las fuerzas físicas lo abandonan, Lorenzo tiene muchas ganas de seguir cultivando sus productos, y lo hace con el apoyo de algunos peones, de este manera logra solventar sus gastos y llevar una vida tranquila.
Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y está muy agradecido con todos los integrantes de su banco comunal por el apoyo y confianza brindada, asimismo reitera su compromiso de ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para abonar sus chacras de cafetales.
texts.en:
Lorenzo, 62, is separated from the mother of his two children. He lives in his own house. Since he was very young he has grown oranges, coffee, and bananas. Of all of his crops, the most profitable has been coffee. There were times when the majority of the farmers did not harvest good coffee, but he did. Therefore, he was able to sell it at a very good price. These earnings served him to buy his land and build a house in the city of Lima. However, upon separating from his wife, he returned to his rural house in his village. He concentrated his efforts on his coffee crops. Even though he is, at times, not very strong, Lorenzo has a great desire to continue growing his products. He has the help of some workers. This way he is able to pay his expenses and live a peaceful life. This is his first loan with MFP. He is very grateful to all of the members of his communal bank for their support and the confidence they have in him. He repeats his promise to be punctual with his payments. The money he is asking for is to by fertilizers to fertilize his coffee crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
A sus 52 años, a María le sobra vitalidad, es casada y madre D. sus 5 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Trabajar en sus propios cultivos le causa mucho placer, por lo que realiza el macheteo y quitado D. los arbustos D. sus chacras D. plátanos y cítricos sin fatiga alguna. Asimismo, trabajar con su esposo le gusta mucho, ya que juntos terminan con tranquilidad dichas faenas, y mediante ellas pueD. educar a sus hijos, quienes también se suman a la labor los fines D. semana. Cuando cosecha menor cantidad D. productos su compradora es una comerciante conocida como “Pochita”, quien le paga un precio considerable a un peso exacto, por ello trabaja con ella desD. hace muchos años. Pero en caso D. cosechar en mayor cantidad, transporta su carga en el carro D. “Pochita” hasta a ciudad D. Lima, donD. ella misma se encarga D. comercializar sus productos lo más rápido posible para regresar el mismo día a su pueblo.
Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y durante estos años (2) no ha caído en morosidad, es más trata D. ahorrar la mayor cantidad posible en su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra D. plantas D. cítricos y abono.
texts.en:
At 52 years old, María still has vitality. She is married and a mother of 5 children who live in her own house. She works with her own crops and it gives her great pleasure to use the machete and remove trees from her plantain and citrus fruit farms without fatiguing. She also likes to work with her husband, since together they finish calmly the mentioned work, and therefore they can educate their children, who also work on the weekends. When she harvests smaller quantities of products her buyer is a dealer known as “Pochita,” who pays per a price according to the exact weight of her products since they have worked together for many years. But in the case of harvesting a larger quantity, she transports her goods in Pochita’s car to the city of Lima, where she herself is in charge of selling her products as quickly as possible so that she can return to her town the same day. This is her third loan with MFP and during these years (2) she has not fallen in debt. Moreso, she tries to save as much as possible in her community bank. She hopes to invest the money that she is asking for now in the purchase of citrus fruit plants and fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of plants and fertilizer

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
El señor Domingo actualmente vive en casa D. su mama; en elL. vive su esposa sus 2 hijos y su papa el hace tiempo compro un terreno el cual ha ido construyendo poco a poco. D. L. manera en L. que el empezó L. construcción fue con un crédito que le otorgo FVP y actualmente en que esta muy agradecido y satisfecho.
Este será su tercer crédito del señor Domingo y todo esto lo hace por que se preocupa mucho por el patrimonio D. su familia es por ello que esta realizando este proyecto.
texts.en:
Sr. Domingo currently lives in his mother’s house with his wife and their 2 children. His father bought for him a piece of land on which to build a house, but the construction has been moving slowly. A loan from FVP was used to start the construction, and he is very grateful and satisfied.

Sr. Domingo is requesting his third loan. He cares very deeply about leaving an inheritance for his children, which is why he wants to complete this project.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish construction of his house

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es:
Sabino tiene 26 años, vive con su pareja y madre de sus 3 hijos. De lunes a viernes, desde las 7 de la mañana hasta 6 de la tarde trabaja en uno de los fundos de su localidad, él lidera todas las faenas de esta hacienda, como el podado, macheteo y limpieza de los cultivos. Las dificultades que tiene son  sobre las herramientas, cuando se pierden o deterioran él tiene que reemplazarlas con su dinero, pero por lo demás se siente muy contento. Sabino desea comprar sus propias chacras para sembrar café, naranjas y plátano, para que cuando sus hijos crezcan no pasen carencias económicas.
Este sería su segundo préstamo con MFP y también asume el cargo de presidente de su banco comunal, debido a la responsabilidad demostrada. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de herramientas de trabajo y para el alquiler de terrenos para iniciar sus propias siembras.
texts.en:
Sabino is 26 years old and lives with his partner, who is the mother of their 3 children. From Monday to Friday, starting at 7am and ending at 6pm, he works on one of the local farms. He is in charge of all the chores around the farm such as pruning, chopping, and clearing the land for cultivation. His difficulties have been with tools, which have been lost or deteriorated over time. He has to replace these tools with his own money. Otherwise, he is very happy with his job. Sabino wants to buy his own farm so that he can grow coffee, oranges, and bananas so that his children can grow up without having to inherit any financial problems.

This is Sabino’s second loan with MFP. He currently serves as president of his Communal Bank because of the responsibility he has demonstrated. The money he requested will be used to purchase tools and pay the rent for farmland so that he can begin growing his own crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools & pay for farmland rental

loans.name: Ma Juana

texts.es:
La señora Ma Juana tiene un negocio llamado “Miscelánea Lupita”  desde hace ya un año, este negocio lo puso pensando en su hija para no descuidarla todo el día y sobre todo para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares. En la tienda vende abarrotes, refrescos, frituras, etc.
En este momento quiere invertirle mas a su negocio  para así tener mas variedad de mercancía y los clientes encuentren lo que busques y por consecuencia tener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Sra. Ma Juana manages a business called “Miscelánea Lupita”, which she started a year ago. The idea for this business came to her because she needed to look after her daughter, and at the same time, help her husband with the family expenses. She sells groceries, soft drinks, chips, and other items from her store.

At this time, she wants to invest more into her business so that she can offer a wider variety of merchandise. As a result, her customers will find what they need and she can generate more revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: La señora Beatriz vive con su esposo el señor Evaristo, son una pareja de personas de edades mayores pero muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras. Ellos viven solitos pero cuentan con el apoyo de sus hijos que aun estando casados los apoyan económicamente, también perciben una pensión y atienden su propio negocio de abarrotes de nombre “Abarrotes Betty” que lo tiene establecido desde hace 7 años, y día a día se hacen de mas clientes ya que gustan de tener una muy buena atención a su clientela y los productos que el cliente solicite; por tal motivo están solicitando este crédito para la compra de mas mercancía por mayoreo y así obtener mayor ganancia.

loans.use: Inversion al negocio (compra de mercancia)

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es: El señor Adrián V. vive con su esposa la señora Justina, ellos viven solitos ya que sus hijos todos ellos están casados, ella se dedica al hogar y atención del señor Adrián, por su lado el tiene un negocio de limpieza de zapatería establecido desde hace 3 años, el mismo construyo y diseño su estante para que sus clientes se sienten y el les pueda brindar su servicio, el motivo por el cual esta solicitando este crédito es para la inversión en la compra de mercancía para la limpieza de zapatos, tales como cepillos, pintura, grasas etc.
texts.en:
Adrián V. lives with his wife, Justina. They live alone because their children are all married. She devotes herself to the home and to taking care of Adrián. He has a shoe shine establishment. He has had it for three years. He built and designed his stand where his customers sit and he can provide his service. He is asking for this loan to buy merchandise like brushes, dye, and polish, etc. for cleaning shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cleaning products for his business

loans.name: María Anelida

texts.es:
María tiene 48 años de edad, su esposo la abandonó hace cuatro años y desde entonces vive junto a sus cinco hijos en el sector 20 de Enero, distrito de Pomalca, ubicado a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Lleva 18 años vendiendo fruta en los exteriores del mercado de la ciudad de Pomalca, ella compra su mercancía en el mercado Moshoqueque (el principal mercado mayorista de la Chiclayo) para luego venderla diariamente a sus clientes habituales.

Este establecimiento es la única fuente de ingreso familiar, motivo por el cual ella trata de dar lo mejor de si para sacar adelante su negocio, su buen trato y la calidad de sus productos ha hecho que su puesto sea uno de los preferidos por las personas que diariamente compran en ese lugar.

María se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más fruta para ampliar su negocio, su más grande anhelo es llegar a ser distribuidora de frutas y de esa manera asegurarle a sus hijos una educación de calidad.

Ella es muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos y compañeros del mercado, los que la consideran una mujer alegre, responsable y que ha sabido sacar a su familia adelante a pesar de las adversidades.
texts.en:
Maria is 48 years old. Her husband abandoned her 4 years ago and since then, she has lived with her 5 children in the January 20th sector of Pomalca District, located 10 minutes outside the city of Chiclayo.

For 18 years she has been selling fruit outside the market in the city of Pomalca. Maria buys her merchandise in the Moshoqueque market (the principle wholesale market of Chiclayo) to resell daily to her regular customers.

Maria's establishment is the only source of her family income and for this reason she tries to do her best to advance her business. Her good service and the quality of her products have make her stand one of the favorites of people who shop daily in this location.

This is Maria's first request for a loan from our institution. She is asking for $175 to buy more fruit and expand her business. Her grand desire is to become a distributor of fruits and, in this manner, assure her children of a quality education. She is well known and respected by her neighbors and companions at the market, who consider her a happy and responsible woman who has known how to move her family forward despite adversities.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY FRUIT TO SELL

loans.name: Susan Day

texts.es:
Susan tiene 21 años de edad y vive junto a su esposo en casa de una tía, ubicada en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, ubicado a 5 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

En Abril de este año ella y su esposo compraron un auto usado con el cual vienen trabajando en la compra y distribución de ropa; ellos viajan a Ecuador o a Lima dos a tres veces por mes para comprar su mercandería y distribuirla en los principales establecimientos de la ciudad; adicionalmente su esposo trabaja como taxista en el auto cuando no están fuera de Chiclayo.

El continuo uso y la antigüedad del vehículo ha hecho que este empiece a sufrir desperfectos mecánicos en el motor por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la reparación y mantenimiento de su unidad móvil.

Su más grande anhelo es llegar a ahorrar el dinero suficiente para comprarse un lote de terreno y contruir en él su casa propia, ellos no perciben otro tipo de ingresos económicos por lo que la reparación de su vehículo es muy importante para el logro de sus objetivos.

Susan es muy estimada por sus clientes y vecinos, ellos la consideran una mujer responsable y entregada a su trabajo.
texts.en:
Susan is 21, and she lives with her husband in her aunt’s house, which is located in the José Leonardo Ortiz district. This is five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. In April of this year she and her husband bought a used car. They use it working in the sale and distribution of clothes. They travel to Ecuador or to Lima two or three times a month to buy their merchandise and distribute it to the main establishments in the city. Also, her husband works as a taxi driver in the car when they are not away from Chiclayo. The continual use and the age of the vehicle have made it start to have mechanical problems with the motor. That is why she has seen the need to ask our institution, for the first time, for a loan for 2,000 PEN. She plans to use it for the repair and maintenance of their car. Her biggest goal is to save enough money to buy some land and build her own house. They do not have another type of income, so the repair of their vehicle is very important to achieve their goals. Susan is held in high esteem by her customers and neighbors. They consider her to be a responsible woman and very involved in her work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintenance of their vehicle

loans.name: Enkhmandakh

texts.en:
Enkhmandakh N. is 48 years old and lives in a ger (a traditional Mongolian felt tent) with her husband and three children in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. Her oldest daughter is unemployed and her youngest son and daughter attend secondary school. Her husband, Batsukh, is disabled and is currently self-employed.

Enkhmandakh operates a clothing retail business in her town. She purchases clothes from China and sells them out of a rented stall at the local market. She started her retail trading business in 2005 with capital of 80,000 tugrugs (approx. 55 USD). Since then, her business has grown rapidly and she has gained much business experience. She attributes her success to her hard work and says that her customers appreciate her honest nature. Today, her working capital exceeds 500,000 tugrugs (approx. 350 USD).

For the future, Enkhmandakh says, “My dream is to expand my business and buy a yard for my ger.” She is requesting a 420,000 tugrug loan to purchase more clothes from China for her clothing business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita E. 58 years old and a widowed, says that their life is the picture of a very poor family. Because of lack of income their children get a low level of education. Her eldest son Jonathan 34 years old finishes a vocational course but now working as a farmer, Salvacion the only daughter age 31 attain only grade 3 in primary level, and the youngest is Jose 20 years old not finish high school, they have their own family right now.

Before sources of their income is comes from selling different kinds of vegetables that gives them a small income that is not enough for their daily expenses. When Clarita joined in Kiva field partner, Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) she used the loan that she gets to put up a hog fattening or raising feeds business. Comes from the revenue of that business that she saves, she put up another business which is variety store. Now, the two businesses are now giving her income that helps her whole family. But she wants this business to grow, so she decided to use her second loan in ASHI to buy things that needed in her two businesses like piglet and feeds for the piglet, rice, canned goods, detergent, soap and other groceries.

Clarita is really caring for his children and their family, she wants to help them in her simple way. That’s why she is concentrating in her business so it can give her more income for them.

loans.use: To finance her variety store and hog fattening (pig raising) business

loans.name: Mrs. Chek Pat Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank Group consists of seventeen people who live in Chroung Sdau village in Takeo province. Mrs. Chek P. was selected the President of the group by its members. She is a good cook, hired by the villagers during wedding ceremonies and parties. Her husband, Mr. Yim Phorn, is a farmer who owns a 1-hectar field on which he cultivates rice. This field has infertile soil which is a challenge, because it affects his crop production. Fertilizer would help make the field more productive. Mrs. Chek P. decided to ask for a loan to buy the fertilizer. She is 37 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is a waiter, two are enrolled in the local school and the youngest is too young to work or study.

Seven members in this group have end-of-term loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. The other group members have monthly payment loans. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to make the crop more productive.

loans.name: Davaajargal

texts.en: V. Davaajargal is a 39 year-old, single mother who lives with her two children, Batzaya and Tsevelsuren, in Uvurkhangai province in central Mongolia. Both of her children currently attend  a local secondary school. Davaajargal operates a small grocery retail business at the central market in the provincial capital city of Arvaikheer. Her business is well known at the market and she has developed a good reputation amongst her customers and competitors. Davaajargal started her grocery retail business in 2000 and works hard every day to grow her business. She possesses good business sense and is very responsible in managing her business. Although, her family enjoys a quality lifestyle, Davaajargal is always focused on her business so that she can provide for her children's school tuition and living expenses. In the future, Davaajargal's main desire is to continue to grow her business so that she can continue to provide a quality life for her family. She is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug (~2,110 USD) loan to purchase supplies for her new grocery business.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her new grocery business.

loans.name: Mrs. Phorn Aet Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Thirteen people who are all living in Chhrouy Sdau village in Takeo province is made up the village bank loan. Mrs. Phorn A. is a village bank president who has been selected the members and they all will use the loan indifferent purposes. She is a farmer who owns 1.5-hectar field of land to cultivate rice. In her plantation, she needs the money to buy fertilizer to support the rice field to make more productive. Her husband, Hang Chan, is a motorbike taxi driver. Mrs. Phorn A. is 50 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another stays at home to do housework and the others are attending the local school. 

Fifteen members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the rice field to make more productive.

loans.name: Doniddemberel

texts.en:
Doniddemberel D. is a 45-year-old single mother who lives with her two children in Uvurkhangai in central Mongolia. Her sons both attend high school which means that they cannot help out with their mother's business.

Doniddemberel started her business in 1992 selling firewood and coal in Arvaiheer market located in the center of Uvurkhangai province. Her retail trading business is the only income source for the family.

Through the years, Doniddemberel has gained a lot of experience and expanded her business each year. By doing this, she has made it possible to store 3 - 5 truckloads of firewood and 2 - 4 truckloads of coal to sell at the market. However, she still needs to expand the amount of goods sold in order to fulfill her dreams. She is requesting a 600,000 tugrug loan to rebuild her firewood and coal storage building and to increase her sales.

loans.use: To rebuild her firewood and coal storage building and to increase her sales

loans.name: Mr. San Sum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
A village bank loan which consists of thirteen people is located in Chhrouy Sdau village in Takeo province and all the members will use the loan in different purposes. Mr. San S. is the village bank president. He is a rice middleman and he owns a rice mill. Since his business is doing well, he needs a loan to buy more rice to mill to re-sell to earn more income. His wife, Mrs. S. Kim Thoung, is a farmer who owns 2-hectar field of land to cultivate rice. This couple has three children, one of whom helps the parents work while the others are enrolled in the local school. 

All the people in this group loans are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more rice to mill to re-sell to earn more income.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda O. is from the village of Catadman, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old and is widowed. Luzviminda owns and operates a business making & selling food, primarily preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Luzviminda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Luzviminda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Mrs. Thol Rin Group Loan

texts.en:
This village bank loan which consists of four people is located in Prek Kranh village in Kandal province and all the members will use the loan which they obtained for different purposes.

Mrs. Thol R. is the group leader and she is silk weaver in the local village. Since this business is going well she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk to weave for her customers.

Mrs. Thol R. is 29 years old and the mother of a child who is attending the local school.Her husband, Mr. Kin Chi, helps her in her business.

loans.use: To buy more silk to weave for her customers

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza who is from the village of Rizal East San Isidro, Isabela manages a humble hog raising business. She is already 42 years old and only finished elementary level of education. Through her patience in raising her hogs she is able to supply the needed basic needs of her family. Riza is also gambling for the success of her business. She is praying that her hogs will not suffer from any illnesses.


Riza wanted to apply for KIVA loans to sustain the needed feeds supply of her raised animals. She is proposing to borrow the amount of PHP5, 000 from the lenders. Raising pigs is very beneficial to her family because compared to other business, hog raising gives her double income if it is maintained well said Riza thus she is patiently maintaining the business.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica manages a general store business. She is already 56 years old and was still strong doing the business. She both stand as father and mother to her four children. Her two children are already married and have their own families. While her two other children are Miriam -27 years old who is under graduate and Reymond - 19 years old is currently taking his studies. Monica wanted to request for a loan amounting to PHP4, 000 as additional business capital to use in her store to grow. According to her, she wanted to buy additional merchandise due to immediate sold out of her retailed goods. She hopes the business would grow and become successful in all her undertakings.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is engaged in food snack vending business in their rural village of Oscariz Ramon, Isabela. She loves vending same through here where she is generating income for her family. She wanted to borrow loan from Kiva lenders of around PHP4, 000 that will be utilize as additional business capital. She hopes to further improve the business so that someday, her family will also be lifted up from poverty. 

Julie is already married to Reynaldo V. Sr. They are blessed with three children, one of them is already married. Her two younger children who were left are still studying; Reynaldo V. Jr. - 16 years old is a high school student and Rizza Joy - 10 years old is in the elementary level of education. Through her business, she hopes to give them her full financial support as they pursue their studies until college.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Hog raising is how Lolita earns income for her family. She wants to have additional business capital for the maintenance of her hog-raising business. She is also asking for financial support to enable her to buy for a sack of hog feed that her business needs. She hopes to obtain a PHP 4,000 loan from Kiva lenders as additional business capital.

Lolita’s husband, Panfilo, who is a house carpenter, also helps her in her business. They are blessed with seven children and two of them already have their own families. Some of her children are still living with them and they are: Analiza - 23 years old, a high school graduate; Hustle Joy - 20 years old; Sunshine - 18 years old, a high school graduate; Feric Art - 16 years old; and Princes - 12 years old who is now in her second year high school.

Lolita hopes that she will be able to continue to support her youngest daughter in her schooling.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria’s goal to improve her business motivated her to work patiently towards her food snack vending business. She cooks macaroni soup, sometimes native or glutinous delicacies, and sometimes pancit (also called pansit - a noodle dish of Chinese origin common in the Philippines). She usually roams house to house in their villages to sell her homemade cooked food snacks.

Victoria earns around PHP 200 a day from her business, which is utilized to help her husband support their family’s immediate needs, especially in terms of their children’s education. In connection with this, Victoria wants to request a loan of PHP 5,000 from Kiva as additional business capital.

Victoria is married to Mario and they live in the beautiful village of Rizal East of San Isidro, Isabela. They are blessed with two children: Marvin - 12 years old, already in grade school; and the youngest, Ma. Claire - 5 years old who is already in her first elementary grade. The couple wants to sustain the needs of their family and improve the business Victoria manages so that they are able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en: Mrs. Chenda S. lives in Cham Bork Tim village in Takeo province. She is a fruit seller.  She Aside from this business, she is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Now she is requesting a loan to buy pump machine, rice seed, and to buy some fruits to sell to earn income. Her husband, Mr. Yeam Rith, is a motorbike taxi driver. Mrs. Chenda S. is 33 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school while the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy pump machine, rice seed, and to buy some fruits to sell to earn income.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Mrs. Sina M. is a villager in Svay Thom village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she is also a chicken breeder. Now she needs a loan to buy fertilizer to support the rice field and she would use the rest of money to chickens, chicken food, and build chicken store. Her husband, Mr. Touy Chan, is a construction worker. Mrs. Sina M. is 27 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the rice field.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites manages a hog-raising business that is situated just near their house. Her family presently resides in Barangay Rizal East, San Isidro, Isabela.

Marites is happily married to Fernando C.. The couple is blessed with three children who are Carlo Jay -17 years old, Carol Joy - 16 years old and Cyryn - 8 years old. All of them are currently studying in college or the elementary level of education. Marites hopes to continuously provide for her children’s need to earn their degrees in college so that they will have a better future someday. According to Marites, education is really important because it will become her children’s weapon in having a bright future.


Marites would like to further expand her pigpen in order to raise a larger number of pigs so that, somehow, she will double her income. She is applying to borrow PHP 5,000 from Kiva lenders for her pigpen expansion and to purchase a sack of feed that will help her pigs grow healthy.

loans.use: To expand her pigpen and to purchase a sack of pigfeed

loans.name: Lalaine

texts.en:
Lalaine C. is asking for financial assistance that will be utilized for the maintenance of their tricycle transport business of which is being drive by her husband with a travel route from their village at Barangay Rizal East San Isidro, Isabela to Santiago City. She wanted to borrow the amount of PHP5, 000 from KIVA lenders. She hopes that lenders will help her in the business to have smooth business operation for her family and to the daily passengers they used to give their transport service.  


She is already 45 years old, married to Joel C.. They are blessed with two children namely Kenjie - 19 years old who graduated in a two- year course and Kevin Joel - 17 years old is already a high school graduate. Lalaine is hoping that she could avail the amount of loan she is requesting to give her children a better education. She is optimistic that she will achieve all her goals in life.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Mrs. Oun V. is a farmer in Prey Chher Tel village in Takeo province. She owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice. In addition, she is a basket seller.

Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn insufficient income to support their family’s living conditions. In order to improve the family conditions, Mrs. Oun V. has decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for breeding.

Mrs. Oun V. is 36 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is a worker, another three are enrolled in the local school and the remaining one is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Tang Sophat, is a construction worker. He is also shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en: Managing a store is the business of Arceli A.. She is thankful because she has been married to Magno who is a good husband. They manage a small farm lot in their rural villages of Osacriz Ramon, Isabela where they also peacefully live. According to her, she would like to avail a loan amounting PHP4, 000 so that she could improve their way of living. The couple is blessed with four children namely Mark Vernie - 26 years old who just finished a vocational course, Gunoffria - 25 years old is a college graduate; Jomar - 22 years old, high school graduate and Jean - 19 years old is already a college freshman. Arceli would be glad if her request loan will be approved to further sustain their family needs in life.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena S. is now 60 years old and already widowed. At her age she’ll never get tired of caring for her children although some of them are now having their own families. As a matter of fact, she’s also caring for the families of her children. She will help them as long as she can, especially in financial terms.

Before, Magdalena had no stable source of income, but when she became a member of Kiva field partner, Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), she started her pig-raising business. She used the loan that she received in starting this business. Also she started a rice-retailing business because, in their place, most of her neighborhood can’t afford to buy a whole sack of rice. Instead, they can buy it on a retail basis (per kilo). In that way Magdalena can help her family because of the extra income while she also helps her neighborhood.

Now, Magdalena wants to use her second loan in ASHI to buy things that are needed for the improvement of her two businesses. She will buy a sack of rice, another piglet to raise, and the different pig-feeds and vitamins.

Magdalena hopes that her businesses become stable and that they will give them enough income for their big family. Most of her children now have their own families but two of them don’t have. She wants them to finish their studies so that their standard of living will change.

loans.use: To buy a sack of rice, another piglet, and pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en: Although single, Maria Theresa M., 39 years old, stands as her family’s breadwinner. She lives with her siblings and parents in Modesta Village, San Mateo, Rizal. Maria Theresa has been managing her general store for four years now. She also distributes bread and pastries to small stores in her community. Most of her time is also devoted to tending her direct-selling business where she gets orders for cosmetics and apparel from her customers. From these combined business activities, she earns at least P30,000 a month - enough to sustain her family’s basic daily needs. Through a friend’s invitation, Maria Theresa became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2008. She wants to expand her business so as to help employ neighbors who are in need. Currently, she needs a loan of P35,000 for this expansion. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer R. is a rice farmer and the mother of four children. Her eldest is 9 years old. She gives her children ample attention, especially about their schooling and health. She started farming when she was single. All of her life revolves around the rice field, since her parents are also farmers. 

She was never qualified to received a loan from the traditional banks in her area, so she joined the CEVI cluster organization where members have the chance to apply and receive a loan from CEVI.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 5,000 to pay for laborers who will help her to prepare her land for planting, and for farm equipment that she rents. Receiving this loan is truly worthwhile, because Elmer does not have another available fund to finance her farming necessities.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Marbel

texts.en:
Maribel D. is 33 years old and the mother of three children. She married late in life, so her eldest child is just 6 years old. She started helping on the farm since 1999. From then on, she learned to love the field because it helps her immensely to provide food, clothing, and other basic necessities to her family.

She would like to request a loan of Php 5,000 that she will use to finance her farm. Receiving this loan is truly worthwhile because she will use the money to pay for the laborers and farm equipment that she used during land preparation.

She said that she likes CEVI services a lot. CEVI gives its clients not only loans, but also provides insurance coverage and education to help their clients' businesses grow.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
53-years old Virginia C. is managing a small rice field. She started tilling her farm since 1980. Now, that more than 2 decades had passed, she wanted to buy more farms to be able to buy her whole family needs. She has three children. All of them are married. She said, what give meaning to her life now are her grandchildren, whom she also supports especially in giving allowance in going to school. 

She requested a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to pay the workers who shaped and prepare her farm ready for planting. The loan as well will help pay the rent for the equipment he used during land preparation. 

This loan will help her grow her farm immensely. She hopes that she will have an abundant harvest after the loan in CEVI.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
57–year old Leonila N. is a rice farmer. She has seven children, 39 years old the eldest and is already married. She started helping her husband till a small rice field since 1990. She saved half of her harvest for family consumption and sold the remainders to her neighbors, friends and even to rice traders.

She would like to ask a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to finance her farm as well as in paying the laborers that toil hard also during land preparation. Receiving this loan will benefit her and her family in sustaining their livelihood.

She said, that she likes CEVI services a lot because it has the lowest interest rate of 2% a month.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Lynie

texts.en:
Lynie I. raises pigs for income. She bathes and feeds the pigs everyday. She has been doing this since 1987 because she just enjoys her job, and she also earns bigger profit in her business. Currently, she has four pigs that she will sell for Php 9,000 each. Piggery is a very feasible business and she wishes to raise more pigs to increase her income.

Now, she would like to request a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy piglets and feed. Some of her loan also will be used to reconstruct her barn.

She likes CEVI services a lot. CEVI provides their clients with not just loans, but training and insurance coverage as well

loans.use: Piglets and feed

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
58-year-old Gloria L. owns a small rice field in her village. She has six children, the oldest of whom is 39 years old. They do not live with her any more. Her husband left her when her children were still young. Now she pays laborers and workers to till her rice field so she can provide food, clothing and other basic needs for her household.

She would like to request a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to finance her farm and to pay her workers for preparing the land and make it ready for planting.

“In CEVI, the monthly payment is easy to repay because it has only a 2% interest rate” she said.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
65-years old Pacita G. is a rice farmer. She started helping her husband till their 1-hectare (~ 2.5 acre) farm in 1978. In 1980, her husband died and she was left behind to manage their rice farm and look after the needs of their 26-year-old child.

She needs a loan of Php 6,000 to pay for farming necessities like the seeds that she has sown and the laborers who helped to till the field. Some of the loan will also be used to buy feed, because she just started raising pigs.

Pacita joined CEVI in 2008. She likes the services because CEVI has only 2% interest rate, which is very affordable to repay.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa D. 44 years old mother of four children in Banga, South Cotabato started raising pigs in 2008. She remembers the time when she had her first piglet and she said she really given her extra time to grow her pigs well. From then on, she likes pigs a lot that is why until now she still raises pigs.

She would like to request a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to purchase feed and buy additional piglets.

Aside from pigs, she also owns a small sari-sari store; the loan will also help in buying additional merchandise in her store to offer her customers a wider selection of goods with variety.

loans.use: Piglets and feed

loans.name: Nornie

texts.en:
Nornie D. owns a 1-hectare (~2.5 acre) rice field. She has three children, the eldest of whom is 26 years old  and wants to study in college. Nornie helps her husband to till their rice farm. When they are not busy on the farm, they visit their fish pond, which is their additional source of income. 

She would like to request a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy fish food and rice seeds. Land preparation is also expensive and the loan will definitely help pay the laborers who prepared the field for planting.

She joined in CEVI program last 2008 and she said, “ CEVI services really helped my family to finance our businesses”.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Susita

texts.en:
54-year old Susita M. started her pig business in 2007. She loves pigs and she earns a larger profit by raising three to four pigs at one time in her barn. She has nine children and all of them are married. Her business is doing great, but she admits that she needs additional capital to expand.

She requested a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to purchase feed and piglets. This loan will help her raise more pigs so she can earn more income in her business.

In 2008 she joined the CEVI credit program. She still retains her membership because, according to her, she likes the services, especially the interest rate, which is 2% a month, and very low and easy to repay.

loans.use: Piglets and feed

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita E. is a 51-year-old mother of four children, one of whom is still in school.  Nenita is married to Julio, a carpenter.

Nenita works hard to pay for their basic daily needs, so she decided to open a general store three years ago with a handful of items to sell and a few thousand pesos to invest. Her general store gradually grew bigger. and Nenita now earns 27, 000.00 a month from her store.

Nenita joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2006.  She has invited other women in her community to her group. She has just finished repaying her previous loan with the cooperative.  She is now on her 10th loan. She has applied for a new loan of P12, 000.00. She dreams of having a larger grocery store some day.  

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Additional capital for business expansion

loans.name: Ilolo Kati Group

texts.en:
Rechois a member of the Ilolo Kati borrower group in Mwanjelwa, Mbeya. She is 38 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children.

Recho has owned a shop business selling  commodities like rice, cooking oil, salts etc for 5 years. she works 6 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 50,000 Tanzanian shillings.


This is Recho`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more shop commodities.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Recho hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Happy and Aida are another member of the same borrower group, they also requested the loan amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to expand their business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for  shop business
