loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
49 years Celerina E. is  a new CEVI client and has four children. She grows cows to feed and clothe her family. She started her business since 2001 and she dreamed to make it nbetter until she could have 10 cows in her farm. In addition to cow, she also sells food. Her customers are her neighbors and pther people aroung their village.

She would like to request a loan of Php 2,000. She will use the loan for the cinstruction of a barn. She needs to have one so that her cows will be secured especially during night time.

Receiving a loan will truly hep her manage her cows well. She said, she likes CEVI services especially the 2% interest rate which is very low and easy to repay.

loans.use: Buy materials for the construction of a barn

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita S. is from the village of San Carlos in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 58 years old. Conchita is married and has 1 adult children. To make a living, Conchita raises and sells pigs.Conchita has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Conchita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Conchita is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Conchita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Mission 2 Newube Asina Group

texts.en:
N. Asina is representing her group. She is twenty-four years old and married. She has four children, three of whom are in school. 

She has a pool table business, where people pay tokens to play and pass time. She has managed to maintain her pool table business for a year. Now she wants to buy another pool table so she can earn more daily income. Although some people think that it in an unusual business, it provides her with a daily income. She is a creative and hard-working businesswoman who knows how to handle customers and win their attention. Her hope for the future is to educate her children and build a better house.

loans.use: To buy another pool table

loans.name: Jennith

texts.en:
Jennith B. is from the village of Tipan in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Jennith is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Jennith sells charcoal to local commnity members. Jennith has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Jennith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennith has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from GDMPC. Jennith is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell to expand product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jennith from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Lanao del Norte, Zamboanga del Sur and Misamis Occidental. Its membership comprise mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy products to sell

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
N. Safina is thirty-seven years old. She is a married woman who is blessed with six children, all of whom go to school. She also cares for one dependent who is is in school, too. 

N. runs a retail shop where she sells drinks and snacks, such as cakes, biscuits, bread, and crisps, and groceries, such as soap, salt, and sugar. She opened her shop in 2005. She is using her loan to stock as many retail items as she can to raise her profit. She is so encouraged since she found out that there is always somewhere to find rescue even when there was no hope of getting money to add capital to her business. Her dream is to buy a car that she will use to generate income.

loans.use: To buy products to sell

loans.name: Lupeta Group

texts.en:
Lena is a member of the Lupeta borrower group in Nzouwe, Mbeya. She is 32 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 2 children. Her  children are 20 and 17  years  old.

Lena has owned a cafe business selling food  for 4 years, she works 8 hours  a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately  350,000 Tanzanian shillings.


This is Lena`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities for her cafe.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Lena  hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Edina is another member  of  the same borrower group, she also requested the amount of 250,000 Tsh in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann P., 27 years old mother of two childrenn is selling bananas for a living. She started her business since April 2009 to be able to send her children to school and buy them a book and their other needs.

After she heard about CEVI, she was delighted to joined in the program because her friends are also CEVI borrowers. She would like to request a loan of Php 4,000. She will use the loan to purchased more banas to resell.

She said that her dream is to have a basic store. She wished to make her bana selling click so that she will have enough capital to start a store.

loans.use: To buy banana for her bananacue selling business

loans.name: Merebeth

texts.en:
41-year-old Merebeth J. owns a small sari-sari (variety) store where she sells rice, bread, sardines and other basic items in Tagbilaran, Bohol. She has four children. Her income from selling goods is very helpful especially in buying food, clothing, and medicine for her and her children, paying the bills, and other costs for their home. 

She would like to request a loan of Php 4,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise to resell. Sshe wanted to offer more selection to her customers. Her dream is to manage a bigger store where she can display more goods and hire more staff.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise to resell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a member of the Lupeta borrower group  in  Nzouwe, Mbeya. She is 47 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 4 children. Her children are 27,24,  20, 18 years old. She also cares for other 2 dependents.

Joyce has owned  a business selling local alcohol for  4  years, she works 6  hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 300,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Joyce`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 300,000Tsh  in order to expand her business.

With  the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Joyce hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize for local alcohol

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha C. owns a small store and she has been selling basic goods since 2005. Among of her customers are the neighbors, travelers, and students who whiled away their time in her store during class break. Editha knows that with her husband income, they could hardly support their family. The store is truly helpful in providing their whole family needs.

She would like to request a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise to resell. In that way, she could be able to attract more customers and improve her normal sales.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise to resell

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the Maendeleo borrower group in Nzouwe, Mbeya. She is 30 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 2 children. Her children  are 18 and 14 years old. she also cares for  other 2 dependents.

Hilda has owned a cafe business selling food for  4 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Hilda`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more food commodities for her cafe business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Hilda hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for  her  cafe business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a member of the Maendeleo borrower group in Nzonwe, Mbeya, she is 36 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 1 child. Her child is 7 years old.

Jane has owned a cafe business selling drinks like soda, juice for 2 years, she works 10 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Jane`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more drinks for her cafe business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Jane hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks

loans.name: Enia

texts.pt:
Enia Naftal Z. nasceu na província de Inhambane, no distrito mais populoso da província (Massinga, a 550 km de Maputo), tem 40 anos de idade, casada e mãe de dois filhos com 16 e 8 anos de idade que freqüentam escola. Estudou ate 6 classe. Parou de estudar quando o seu pai perdeu a vida, não tinha quem podesse assumir despesas escolares. Vive em casa própria com a família e sem ninguém mais por sustentar.

Saiu de Inhambane no ano de 1974 para cidade central da Beira, viveu 24 anos, e chegou ao distrito de boane em 1988, juntamente com a mãe  e irmãos.
É comerciante há bastante tempo numa mini-mercearia/loja onde vende diversos produtos (alimentares de primeira necessidade e cosméticos). Não tem empregados. Aprendeu esta actividade com a sua tia, quando trabalhava como empregada domestica.
Tem doze anos de experiência nesta actividade e rende mensalmente aprox. 4.500,00MT. Vende mais sabão, fósforos, caldo, açúcar, bolachas e outros.

O marido também faz quase o mesmo tipo de negocio noutro estabelecimento. Este é o segundo empréstimo da Enia no valor de 14.000,00MT para compra e venda de produtos (sabão, fósforos, caldo, açúcar, bolachas e outros). O primeiro credito foi de 11.00,00MT para aumento de volume do stock.

Nunca tinha levantado empréstimos em outros bancos, mas já foi co-devedora para sua irmã levantar credito no Micro Banco Procredito.
Espera reembolsar sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos com objectivo de construir uma pequena pastelaria.
texts.en:
Enia Naftal Z. was born in Inhambane, in the Massinga province, Mozambique. She is 40 years old, married and has two children aged 16 and 8, both attending school. She finished 6th grade but had to drop school when her father passed away, and she had no one to help her out with school expenses. She owns a house where she lives with her family. Enia left Inhambane in 1974 and moved to Beira, where she lived for 14 years, and then moved to Boane with her mother and brothers in 1988. She learned how to be a salesperson years ago from her aunt, and has been doing it for the past 12 years, selling several products at a convenience store. She has no employees. She makes approximately 4.500,00MT (U$ 170) per month. She mostly sells soap, matches, sugar, cookies, etc. Her husband has a similar job at a different store. This is Ernia's second loan, and she asks for 14.000,00MT (U$ 525) to buy more inventory. Her first loan was 11.000,00MT that she used for the same purpose. She has never taken loans in other banks. She hopes to be able to pay it in a reasonable time so she can make more loans in the future. She dreams to one day be able to open her own pastry shop.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: basic merchandise to sell at her store

loans.name: Odet

texts.pt:
Odete Antonio M. nasceu no distrito de boane, tem 27 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 2 filhos com 3 e 9 anos de idade, a mais velha estuda na escola publica de boane. Odete estudou ate 6 classe e parou cedo para ir ao lar. Actualmente separada vive somente com os filhos na casa própria e sem ninguém sob sua responsabilidade.

Cresceu na companhia dos seus pais, no mesmo distrito de Boane, e nunca mudou de residência. Tem saído para áfrica de sul para visitar familiares.
Vende roupa usada para todas as idades há mais de 10 anos em frente ao mercado da vila de boane. Compra cada fardo a 5.100,00MT, revende a 7.500,00MT ganhando 2.000,00MT no final de cada mês. as vezes vende um fardo e meio.

Já teve empréstimos em outras instituições similares para o exercício da mesma actividade e tendo pagado sem problemas. Teve informações sobre a Hluvuku-Adsema através de vizinhas clientes da instituição.

Este vai ser o terceiro empréstimo da Odete com a instituição no valor de 13.000,00MT para compra de fardos de roupa usada. Espera reembolsar sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos com objectivo de construir um estabelecimento de alvenaria, para melhor vender os seus produtos e ganhar mais clientes.
texts.en:
Odete Antonio M. was born in the district of Boane. She is 27 years old, single, and the mother of 2 children ages 3 and 9. The oldest goes to the Boane Public School. Odete went to school through the 6th grade and stopped early to be in the home. She is recently separated and lives alone with her children in her own home. She does not care for anyone else. She grew up with her parents in the same district of Boane, and she never moved. However, she has gone to South Africa to visit family. She has been selling used clothing for all ages for more than 10 years in front of the market in the town of Boane. She buys each bundle for 5,100MT and sells them for 7,500MT earning her 2,000MT at the end of each month. Sometimes she sells a bundle and a half. She has received other loans from similar institutions and paid them off without problems. She got information about Hluvuku-Adsema through neighbors who are clients. This will be her third loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 13,000MT to purchase bundles of used clothing. She hopes to pay off the loan without issue so she can apply for more credit with the objective of constructing an brick establishment to improve the sales of her products and gain more customers.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and Sell used clothing (all ages)

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a  member of the Maendeleo borrower group in Nzonwe, Mbeya. she is 30  year  old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 15, 12, 10  years  old.


Amina has owned a food  business  selling Bites for 5  years, she works 6 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately  200,000 Tanzanian shillings.


This is Amina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 250,000Tsh in order to buy more commodities like cooking oil, wheat flours for her business.


With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Amina hopes to save more money, pay school fees,  get more food for family,  and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more wheat flour, cooking oil

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en:
Rizalina Bulabos, a 34-year-old mother of one child, sells vegetables. She earns enough income that she can support her family. She also has baking experience from high school. If she can get enough capital, she wants to open a bakery.

She would like to request a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy additional vegetables to resell. Some of the loan will be used to buy materials for making bread for her so she can start a small bakery business.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Rubens Manuel

texts.pt:
Rubens Manuel M. nasceu na cidade de xai-xai (provincial de gaza a 230 km de Maputo), tem 50 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 8 e 18 anos. Todos estudam. Rubens não concluiu o terceiro ano na escola comercial de xai-xai para começar a trabalhar para auto-sustento. Vive com a família na casa própria e a esposa estuda nas aulas de alfabetização de adultos.

Saiu de xai-xai para maputo a procura de melhores condições de vida e conseguiu emprego na empresa de caminhos de ferro de Moçambique, onde é reformado. Estava afecto na estação de comboios de boane na revisão de materiais. Ganha como pensão, 2.500,00MT. Para alem deste valor, recebe mais 2.400,00MT provenientes dos trabalhos que faz na casa da juíza do tribunal distrital de boane como segurança.

Nunca teve empréstimos em bancos e este vai ser o seu primeiro credito no valor de 12.000,00MT para reabilitar a cobertura da sua casa, comprando chapas de zinco e barrotes. Espera reembolsar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos com objectivo de fazer um aviário.
texts.en:
Rubens Manuel M. was born in Xai-Xai (230 km from Maputo). He is 50 years old, married with 4 children between the ages 8 and 18, all of them students. Rubens had to drop school when he was on 3rd grade in order to work and support himself. He owns a house, and his wife is learning how to read at the adult's school. Rubens left Xai-Xai to Maputo searching for a better life, and soon got a job at the Mozambique Railway Company, from where he retired. He worked at the Boane train station. He gets a pension of 2.500,00MT. In the top of that, he makes 2.400,00MT per month as a security guard at the district judge's house. He has never borrowed money before, and this is going to be his first loan in the amount of $450 in order to buy joists and zinc plaques to fix his house's ceilings. He hopes to pay the loan without problems so he can apply for more loans and make and aviary.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction materials

loans.name: Oeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Oeurn N. was born in 1980. She lives in Prey Chhoer Teal Village in Takeo Province. She sells baskets. Her husband, Mr. Minh Sokha, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he grows rice and vegetables. He is also a construction worker. Since his workplace is far from his home, he usually pays a lot of money for motor taxi transport to work. Thus, Mrs. Oeurn N. has requested a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to ride to work. This couple has four children, two of whom attend the local school. The others are too young to work or study. Her husband appears on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to ride to work.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sumail

texts.pt:
Sumail J. nasceu no extremo norte do pais (na província de Cabo delgado a 3.500km de Maputo), tem 39 anos de idade, casado e pai de um filho de cinco anos de idade. Primeiro estudou e parou na 5 classe e retomou neste no curso noturna. Vive na casa própria com sua esposa.

Saiu da província de Cabo Delgado sozinho para Maputo a procura de melhores condições de vida em 1996. Viveu em casa de um familiar conterrâneo e depois emigrou para áfrica do sul a procura de emprego. Não foi bem sucedido tendo resolvido voltar a boane para iniciar uma actividade de rendimento. Durante a sua estadia na áfrica do sul aprendeu a profissão de cabeleireiro. 
Actualmente possui um salão de cabelaria onde trabalha há mais de 5 anos de experiência e rende aproximadamente 5.000,00MTpor mês que aplica no sustento da família constituída e pagamento de credito.

Nunca tinha levantado empréstimos em bancos, este é o seu segundo credito com a Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 11.500,00MT para compra de material de construção (cimento, pedra e outros). O primeiro credito foi para compra de cimento e blocos no valor de 6.000,00MT que pagou sem problemas.

Espera reembolsar em tempo recorde para aceder a mais empréstimos. Quer ver a sua casa de alvenaria terminada para posterior apetrecha mento.
texts.en:
Sumail J. was born in Cabo Delgado, 3.500km from Maputo, in the extreme northern part of Mozambique. He is 39, married and the father of a 5 year old boy. He droped school in 5th grade. He lives with his wife. He left Cabo Delgado to go to Maputo in 1996, searching for a better life. After that, he migrated to South Africa looking for work. While living there, he learned how to be a hairdresser, and then went back to Boane and started his own business. Now he owns a hair salon, and for the past 5 years he's been cutting hair and making around $5.000,00MT (U$ 175) per month, which he uses to support his family and pay back loans. This is his second loan with Hluvuku-Adsema, in the amount of 11.500,00MT (U$425) to buy construction supplies (cement, rocks, etc). The first loan was used to buy concrete and blocks in the amount of 6.000,00MT which he paid back without a problem. He hopes to make the money back in record time in order to apply for other loans. He wants to see his brick house finished so he can improve it later on.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction supplies (concrete, rocks, sand)

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel S. is from the village of North Poblacion Guinsiliban in Camiguin. She is 43 years old. Maribel is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Maribel makes and sells snacks and other delicacies to the local community. Maribel has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Maribel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Maribel is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Maribel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Sokhol

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhol E. is a villager in Kdei Ta Houk village in Takeo province. She is a Krama seller. She is also a pig breeder. Since her breeding pigs business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets and pig food for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Srey Chhrorn, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Sokhol E. is 39 years old and the mother of two children who are attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more piglets and pig food for breeding.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a  member of the Maendeleo borrower group in, Nzonwe, Mbeya, she is 29  year old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 17, 14, 11 years old. 

Lucy has owned a crops business selling  nuts for 3 years, she works 3 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings. 

This is Lucy`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to  buy more nuts for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Lucy hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more nuts for sale

loans.name: Atumane

texts.pt:
Atumane A. nasceu na província de Nampula, no distrito de Angoche, tem 49 anos de idade, separado e pai de 7 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 12 e 27 anos. Todos estudam nas escolas publicas de boane. Vivem na casa própria com os filhos, 7 netos e 3 irmãos sob sua responsabilidade. Estudou ate 8 classe tendo parado quando saiu o seu nome para cumprir o serviço militar obrigatório.

Cumpriu a tropa nas províncias de nampula e zambezia e saiu a maputo (boane) e com sua família (esposa e filhos) a procura de melhores condições de vida. Separou se da esposa por motivos sociais e mandou a de volta à terra natal. Trabalha na companhia de desminagem como sapador, mas também é comerciante no mercado central de boane. Vende arroz, açúcar, farinha e outros.

Rende aproximadamente 5.000,00MT por mês proveniente das vendas que efectua com ajuda dos filhos. Na empresa de desminagem recebe cerca de 1.650,00MT em 5 dias por mês ou em função da necessidade do trabalho.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos e este é o seu terceiro credito com a Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 12.000,00MT para compra de produtos (arroz, açúcar, farinha e outros). Os primeiros empréstimos foram de 8.500,00MT e 10.500,00MT respectivamente para pratica da mesma actividade.

Conheceu a instituição na através de amigos e residentes, também clientes da instituição. Espera reembolsar sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos com objectivo de comprar uma camioneta para facilitar no transporte de mercadorias que adquire na cidade de maputo
texts.en:
Atumane A. was born in the province of Nampula, Angoche District, Mozambique. He is 49 years old, divorced and the father of seven children with ages between 12 and 27. They all go to public school in Boane. The 7 children, plus 7 grandchidlren and 3 brothers all live at his house, under his responsibility. Atumane had to drop school in 8th grade when he was drafted to the army. He served in Nampula and Zambezia then left for Maputo with his wife and children searching for a better life. He later divorced his wife and she went back to her hometown, leaving him with the children. He works at a mine clearance company as a sapper, but he's also a salesman at Boane's central market. With the help of his children, he sells rice, sugar, flour, and other items, which brings them approximately 5.000,00MT (U$175) per month. At the mine clearance company he makes about 1.650,00MT (U$60) for 5 days of work, depending on the amount of work available. He has never taken loans in other banks and this is his 3rd loan with Hluvuku-Adsema. He asks for 12.000,00MT (U$450) to buy more products (rice, sugar, flour, etc). His first two loans where for 8.500,00MT and 10.500,00MT, for the same purpose. He hopes to pay the loan back within reasonable time so he can apply for other loans, in order to buy a truck to help the transportation of merchandise he buys in Maputo.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: food products (rice, sugar, flour)

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Mrs. Sun L. lives in Moeun Tomrang village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1.5-hectar field of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. Her husband, Mr. L. Chhorn, is a construction worker. Now Mrs. Sun L. is applying a loan to buy two cows for breeding. She hopes to increase income and improve the family living conditions with this loan. Her husband is in the picture with on the right.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy two cows for breeding.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: vegetable to resell

loans.name: Ikuti Group

texts.en:
Antelma is a  member of the Ikuti borrower group in Nzonwe, Mbeya. She is 48 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 4 children. Her children are 33,32,28,20 years old.

Antelma has owned a food business selling eggs for 5 years, she works 10 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 300,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Antelma`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 250,000 Tsh in order to buy more Eggs for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Antelma hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more eggs  for  sale

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhom H. was born in 1968 and lives in Doem Pour village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Van Sokhorn, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. On this plantation, they face an obstacle because their field in far from an irrigation system which is affecting their crop productivity. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Sokhom H. decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump machine and fertilizer to support the field to make the crop more productive. This couple has four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory and two are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a pump machine and fertilizer

loans.name: Buyonjo 2 Abdalah Fatuma Group

texts.en: A. Fatuma is the group representative of the Buyonjo 2 group. She is thirty-one years old and married with seven children, who are all in school. She has been selling new clothes since 1999. She is using this loan to to purchase new gentlemen's and ladies's clothes to sell. She is active woman who encourages women in her community to work hard and set up any business they can manage, rather than being lazy and totally dependent on husbands and relatives. Her dream is to obtain a good house.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes to sell

loans.name: Judi

texts.en:
Judi S. sells beans and green vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase cooking oil to sell. Judi is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. She has two children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent. 


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is a member of the Ikuti  borrower group in Nzouwe, Mbeya, she is 36 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 5 children. Her children are 22, 18, 15, 10, and 1  years  old.

Lida has owned a food business selling bites for 6 years, she works 8 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shilling.

This is Lida first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities for  her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Lida hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy wheat flours, cooking oil

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida S. is from the village of Mambajao in Camiguin. She is 47 years old. Aida is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Aida sells fruit in the local community. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Aida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Aida is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Aida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita R. opened her sari-sari (variety) store in 2004. She has three children and a supportive husband who always helps her run the business. She started borrowing from CEVI in March 2009. It was her second loan from CEVI and she has been conscientious about repaying her loan from the beginning.

She would like to request another loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to purchase additional stock to resell. This loan will help her to offer a wider selection of goods. With variety, she will be able to attract more customers and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise to resell

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en: Mrs. Pheap T. lives in Ta Vong village in Takeo province. She is a good housewife. Her husband, Mr. Bun Noeun, repairs motorbikes. This couple has five children, two of whom are construction workers while the other two are enrolled in the local school, and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Now Mrs. Pheap T. is applying for a loan to buy a motorbike for her family's use. She hopes this motorbike will make it easier for her husband’s work and her children to drive to work too. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her family's use.

loans.name: Siri

texts.en: Siri M. is currently in the business of selling fish both fresh and smoked ones and is requesting a loan to open up store for keeping smoked fish for strategy to sell.  Siri is 28 years old and is Married with a husband that is a business man. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: open up store for keeping smoked fish to sell

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap S. is a villager from the An Doung Samreth Village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she grows rice and vegetables. She faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil and it is far from an irrigation system. To solve this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and rent a water pump. She will use the rest of money to buy three cows for breeding. 

Her husband, Mr. Chea Chhorn, is a cow middleman. Mrs. Sopheap S. is 40 years old and the mother of four children. One of her children is employed in a garment factory, two are enrolled in the local school, and the youngest is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rent a water pump

loans.name: Santiago

texts.en:
Santiago G. is from the village of Alangilan, Sagay Camiguin. She is 59 years old, and is married with 3 adult children. To make a living, Santiago owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing a videoke/sing along business to local community members. Santiago has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Santiago joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Santiago has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Santiago is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Santiago from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Duk

texts.en: Duk S., 48, sells groceries. He usually buys produce in bulk from a market supplier and sells it from his house. Normally, he can make an average income of $6.00 per day. He also uses his existing motorbike to run a taxi service for additional income. His wife, SamArt, aged 45, helps him with the business. She also sells a few vegetables in the market. The couple now has six children, four of whom still live with them in the family home. Duk S. will use his second loan to accumulate a large amount of grocery items to resell.

loans.use: To accumulate a large amount of grocery items to resell.

loans.name: Enita

texts.en:
Enita M. is currently in the business of selling books at the bookshop and is requesting a loan to stock more books to sell. Enita is 35 years old and is married to a builder. She has 4 children and all of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to develop a pharmacy.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more books to sell in her bookstore,

loans.name: Sengulu Nambozo Jackyln Group

texts.en: N. Jacklyn is a business woman of thirty-seven years, married with three children whom one is schooling and she looks after two dependents schooling too. She is operating charcoal business for so far eight-years. She is requesting for the loan to purchase bags of charcoal at least 100 bags and above to supply as a wholesalerto retailers and also sell to his usual customers. She is a hardworking business woman whose dream is to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal at least 100 bags and above to supply as a wholesalerto retailers and also sell to his usual customers.

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Noeun S. lives in Kdei Ta Houk Village in Takeo Province. She is a pig breeder. Since her breeding pigs business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more ten piglets and pig food for breeding. 

Her husband, Mr. Tang Tha, owns a rice mill which has been rented by a villager. Mrs. Noeun S. is 31 years old and the mother of three children. Two of her children are enrolled in the local school, The youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more ten piglets and pig food for breeding.

loans.name: Jay

texts.en:
Jay W. is from the village of North Poblacion, Guinsiliban Camiguin. He is 35 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jay owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle services to transport passengers in the local community. Jay has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Jay joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jay has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Jay is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jay from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Mile

texts.en: Mile S. is currently in the business of selling fruits like gavva, ovacado, oranges and many others and is requesting a loan to stock more fruits to sell.  Mile is 28 years old and is Married with a husband that is a soldier. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase fridges for keeping fruits longer BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more fruits to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam sells fufu in her restaurant. Fufu is a food gotten from cassava and it is eaten with soup in Nigeria. This is her main source of income and she hopes to make more profits. She is a widow with 9 children. Mariam is 52 years old. She says thanks to all kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more cassava for making fufu to sell

loans.name: Kun

texts.en: Mrs. Kun K. lives in Moeun Tom Rong Village in TaK. Province. She breeds poultry. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more chickens and duck food. Her husband, Mr. Eam Chreb, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he grows rice. Mrs. Kun K. is a 31 years old and the mother of four children. Three of her children attend the local school, but the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and duck food

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Khan

texts.en: Khan C. is 29 years old and lives in Phnom Penh City where he earns a living selling used goods locally. He owns his bicycle which he uses to buy used goods around his community. His wife is a local farmer. She also stays at home to look after the housework. This couple was married years ago but have no children. Khan C. will be using his loan to purchase a motorbike which he will use to support his business transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to support his business transportation.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch C. is a farmer in An Doung Samreth village in Takeo province. She owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. She has a problem with her plantation because she does not have enough money to buy rice seed, fertilizer, or hire laborers to work on the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. C. Kouy, is a construction worker. Mrs. Touch C. is 55 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer, and hire laborers to work on the field.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy A. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin. She is 31 years old. Mercy is married with 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Mercy owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Mercy has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Mercy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercy is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Mercy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Eucharia

texts.en: Eucharia bakes and also sells baking materials like baking powder, sugar, flour, etc. She hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more baking materials to sell. Eucharia is 35 years old and married with four children.  She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baking materials to sell

loans.name: Wanambwa 2 Lesiya Namudila Group

texts.en: Lesiya N. is the group’s chairperson and she is forty years old, married, with two children both attending school. She sells new clothes and has been doing this since 2002. She is requesting a loan to add capital to her business as well as purchase more new clothes, such as dresses, trousers, t-shirts, skirts, socks, etc. for sale. She is works hard, and her future hope is that through this hard work she will be able to obtain a plot of land and live a good life.

loans.use: To add capital to her business as well as purchase more new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jose Augusto

texts.es: José Augusto F. A., reside en San Luis Talpa departamento La Paz, Junto a su familia maneja un negocio de venta de  mangos,  ubicado en el mercado central. Con tan solo siete años de experiencia, vive con su esposa y  tres hijastros, todos estudiantes. Actualmente José solicita un préstamo para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería (mangos), que le permitan generar mayores ingresos  y hacer crecer su negocio, con esta deliciosa y exotica fruta, que es muy demandada por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jose Augusto F. A. lives in San Luis Talpa, in the La Paz region. Together with his family, he runs a business selling mangoes, located in the town's central market. He has only seven years of experience, and he lives with his wife and three stepchildren, all of them students. He is currently requesting a loan to buy new products and raw materials in order to expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding his inventory of mangoes

loans.name: Floripes

texts.en:
Floripes B. is from the village of Alga Catarman, Camiguin. She is 49 years old, and is married with 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Floripes owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Floripes has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Floripes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Floripes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Floripes is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Floripes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ana Dilma

texts.es: Ana Dilma G. vive en San Luis Talpa municipio del departamento de La Paz. Ana  tiene 58 años de edad, vive solo con su esposo, pues sus hijos dejaron la casa hace ya varios años. Ana Dilma y su esposo siempre han sido personas luchadoras y emprendedoras, y acumulan ya 36 años de manejar un pequeño comedor y venta de bebidas, que montaron tiempo atrás para mantener a la familia. Ana solicita un préstamo para reinvertir en su añejo negocio y continuar luchando y creciendo junto a su esposo.

loans.use: Para invertir en su negocio

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: S., age 24, is garment worker living in the best territory of Phnom Penh. She is married to Thear, age 25, who is a local farmer. He climbs palm trees as well as cultivates rice. They have one young child who is enrolled in school. The rice growing season is coming and S.’ husband lacks some of the farming tools that could ease his hard labor on the farm. Therefore, S. requests a loan of $600 to help buy a cow for her husband which he can use to plow the farmland.  Then they will raise its offspring. S. and her husband are pictured.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah E. is 48 years old and lives in Bagong Silang, Caloocan City.  She is married to Gregorio, a merchandiser, and she works in direct selling, a tried and tested alternative source of income for most Filipinos.

Sarah enjoys her work selling cosmetics and apparel offered by prominent brand names like Sarah Lee and Personal Collection.  She has been in this business for five years now and earns close to P10,000 a month especially during peak months like Christmas season.  She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative last year.  She is applying for a P12,000 loan to purchase more items to sell.  

She works hard to help her husband pay for their basic daily needs, and she dreams of her family will soon live in their own house on their own property.

About CCT:
The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Adoni

texts.en: Adoni S. sells women's underwear and children's clothing of various shapes and sizes. She started this business in 2002. She is 40 years old and married with five children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Gabil

texts.en:
Gabil M. is currently in the business of selling bread and tea and is requesting a loan to open up a restaurant.  She is 38 years old and married, and her husband is a teacher. They have 4 children who all attend school.  She will use the profits from her restaurant to pay school fees for her children and provide them with basic school materials like books and pens.

About BRAC:
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a resturant.

loans.name: Ana Miriam

texts.es: Ana Miriam M. D. M. vive en Colón municipio del departamento D. La Libertad.  Tras casarse muy joven con su ahora esposo quien trabaja D. empleado en un taller, Ana ha tenido un camino difícil por la vida, lleno D. continuos desafíos y obstáculos.  A pesar D. sus dificultades matrimoniales Ana Miriam ha salido adelante, y maneja ahora exitosamente un negocio D. costura, para el cual solicita un préstamo para comprar materia prima y formalizar su visión.
texts.en:
Ana Miriam M. D. M. lives in the municipality of Colón in the department of La Libertad. Because she married her husband, who works as an employee in a workshop, at a very young age, Ana has had a difficult life, full of continuous challenges and obstacles. In spite of her marriage difficulties, Ana Miriam has gone forward and now successfully manages her dressmaking business, for which she is requesting a loan to buy raw materials and to formalize her vision.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make clothes

loans.name: Bakary

texts.fr:
Né vers 1961 à Socourani dans la préfecture Sikasso, Monsieur Bakary Berthé est un polygame qui a 2 épouses et est père de huit enfants. Il réside avec sa famille à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, il s’est vite initié aux activités génératrices de revenus en l’occurrence l’achat et la vente des engrais, pesticides et insecticides il y a maintenant plus de vingt  ans. Avec ses deux décennies d’expérience dans ce domaine, il réjouit d’une forte réputation et accueille beaucoup de commandes, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins font défaut, il décida ainsi d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à deuxième prêt individuel. Le précédent a été bien remboursé.
Il sollicite ce prêt pour d’acheter, 10 sacs d’urées, 10 sacs de complexes maïs, 8 sacs de complexes coton, 4 cartons d’insecticides et pesticides. Il s’approvisionne auprès du représentant de TOGUNA (une usine de fabrique d’engrais) à Sikasso et effectue ses ventes dans son magasin au nouveau marché de Médine Sikasso. Avec une clientèle composée  essentiellement d’agriculteurs certains de ses clients payent au comptant, d’autre à crédits.
 Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born around 1961 in Socourani in the prefecture of Sikasso, Mr. Bakary Berthé is a polygamous man who has two wives.  He is the father of eight children.  He resides with this family in Hamdallaye, a working-class district in the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  Not having had the chance to go to school, he was soon introduced to revenue-generating work, in this case, buying and selling fertilizers, pesticides, insecticides now over 20 years ago.  With his two decades of experience in this domain, he enjoys a solid reputation and accommodates many orders.  But the resources necessary for satisfying these demands are lacking.  Thus, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso.  He is now on his second individual loan with it.  The previous one was repaid.  He's requesting this loan to buy ten sacks of urea, ten sacks of fertilizer mix for corn, eight sacks of a fertilizer mix for cotton, and four boxes of insecticides and pesticides.  Supplies are gotten from the representative of TOGUNA (a factory making fertilizers) in Sikasso. And sales are made in his store at the new marketplace of Médine Sikasso.  His customer base is composed essentially of farmers.  Some of them pay in cash, others on credit.  With this loan, he envisions realizing a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA.  With the profits gained, he plans to meet the bulk of his expenses and his family's too and to cover the loan interest.  The rest will be invested in his business.  

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and insecticides

loans.name: Guillermo Alfredo

texts.es: Guillermo Alfredo H. G. reside en Lourdes Colon en el departamento de La Libertad.  Junto a Guillermo y su esposa viven sus dos hijas, quienes han sido la principal razón para la superación de Guillermo. La más pequeña de tan solo 5 años recién aprende a leer y pronto empezara su educación primaria. Guillermo trabaja en una venta de materiales de construcción, negocio para el cual solicita un préstamo para comprar nueva materia prima que le permita expandir su negocio.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel B. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin. She is 59 years old and married with 6 adult children. To make a living, Isabel sells both food and daily use products in the local community.  She has been in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

Isabel joined HSPFI in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Isabel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI which she used to expand her product offering. Isabel is now requesting her 4th HSPFI loan, for 13000 PHP, to purchase additional products to sell.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Safiatou

texts.fr:
Madame Safiatou D. a  48 ans et vit dans une grande famille avec son époux et ses six  enfants (1 garçon et 5 filles) à Sanoubougou I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Safiatou D., après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et vente de pâtes et légumes de manioc afin de  fabriquer de l’Attièkè,  qu’elle a appris auprès d’une voisine venue de la république de Côte d’Ivoire; depuis plus de vingt ans. Elle mène son activité au domicile conjugal. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée  pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ cinq ans. Après 3 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier (Association SABALY de Sanooubougou I), elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel  tous correctement remboursés.
 Vue son expérience, Madame Safiatou D. vend ses marchandises au comptant ou à crédit et très souvent en gros à une clientèle composée très généralement des femmes qui vont aller revendre en détail. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt,  30 sacs de racines de manioc à Sikasso et environnants  et  50 sacs de pâtes de manioc (Tièkèdoro) à Bouaké (République de la Côte d Ivoire) afin de  fabriquer de l’Attièkè de bonne qualité.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.

loans.use: Achat de pâte de racines  de manioc.

loans.name: Vicenta Del Carmen

texts.es: Vicenta Del Carmen S. M. reside en Lourdes Colon municipio del departamento de La Libertad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos menores de edad Oscar de 9 años y Diana de 7.  Ambos hijos han crecido muy apegados  a su mamá, y pasan las tardes en la pequeña venta de productos de belleza que Vicenta maneja en su casa. Vicenta solicita un préstamo para comprar nueva materia prima y buscar un mayor desarrollo de su negocio.

loans.use: Surtir su inventario

loans.name: Berta Noemí

texts.es: Berta Noemí Q. D. G. resiD. en el municipio D. Armenia en el departamento D. Sonsonate.  Vive junto a su esposo, hijos y un nieto D. 4 años D. edad, que estudia su educación básica. Berta maneja un negocio D. venta D. ropa en el mercado D. Armenia, y es con los ingresos D. este negocio, con lo que mantiene a su extensa familia. Berta solicita un préstamo para comprar nueva mercadería para aumentar las ventas D. su negocio y poder proveer a su familia D. una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Berta Noemí Q. D. G. lives in the municipality of Armenia in the department of Sonsonate. She lives with her husband, children and a grandson, who is 4 years old and is in primary school. Berta manages a clothing business in the market in Armenia. With the income from this business, she takes care of her large family. Berta is requesting a loan to buy new merchandise to increase her sales and so that she can proviD. her family with a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply new products to her business

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Ngozi is 58 years old and married with ten children. She sells foodstuffs and drinks within her community in Lagos State, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan of N 70,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Enkhtaivan

texts.en:
Enkhtaivan A., a 36-year-old businesswoman, lives with her husband and two children in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. Both of her children currently attend a local secondary school. Enkhtaivan operates a small milk and dairy products business in her town. She purchases milk and dairy products from local farmers and sells them throughout her community.

Enkhtaivan started her milk and dairy trade business in 1998 with capital of 500,000 tugrugs (approx. 345 USD). She has gained much selling and business experience since she started, and attributes her success to her good business sense and hard-working attitude. Today, her working capital exceeds 2,000,000 tugrugs (approx. 1,381 USD) For the future, Enkhtaivan says, “My plan is to expand my business even more and save for my children's future”.

Enkhtaivan is requesting a 2,314,000 tugrug (approx. $1,598 USD) loan to purchase more milk and dairy products for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more milk and dairy products for her business.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: Marta P. Vda. D. N., resiD. en Colon en el departamento La Libertad.  Marta tiene 66 años D. edad y por razones desafortunadas D. la vida, quedó viuda hace unos cuantos años. La vida como viuda no ha sido fácil, pero la compañía D. su hijo mayor ha sido D. gran ayuda. Juntos, manejan un negocio venta D. leña y piñatas fabricadas por ella. Ambos solicitan un préstamo para comprar nueva materia prima y llevar su negocio un paso adelante.
texts.en:
Marta P. Vda. D. N. lives in Colon in the department of La Libertad. Marta is 66 years old and for unfortunate reasons, she has been a widow for some years. Her life as a widow has not been easy, but the company of her oldest son has been a great help. Together, they manage a business that sells firewood and piñatas maD. by her. They are both requesting a loan to buy new raw materials and take their business a step forward.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her piñatas

loans.name: Supur

texts.en:
Supur M. is currently in the business of selling various items in her shop and is requesting a loan to stock more goods to sell.

Supur is 37 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has 4 children and her children go to school.

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children and purchase foodstuffs for home consumption.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more goods in her shop

loans.name: Ana Miriam

texts.es: Ana Miriam M. D. A.  resiD. en Soyapango en el departamento San Salvador. Ana  vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos menores D. edad, ambos estudiantes D. educación primaria. Ana maneja un  negocio D. panadería ubicada en su casa, su pan es distribuido en varias colonias D. Soyapango . Ana solicita un crédito para compra D. materia prima y compra D. una vitrina para aumentar la venta y distribución D. sus productos D. panadería.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Dambe Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Dambe (7 mariées et 3 célibataires), avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Sanoubougou 1,  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative  de la république du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur deuxième  prêt de groupe. Le prêt précédent a  été bien remboursé. 
Elles font  comme activités  la vente de  médicaments, de tissus, de condiments alimentaires,  des fruits, de l’huile etc.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 4 emballages de médicaments, 5 emballages de condiments alimentaires, 4 sacs d’oranges, 2 cartons de pommes, 2 sacs d’ananas,  3 bidons de 20 litres d’huiles alimentaires et 4 balles de tissus. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants.
  Elles vendent à Sikasso ville dans les  différents marchés  de façon fixe et dans les  quartiers de façon ambulante, au comptant, souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 31.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Certaines d’entre elles comptent acheter un lot à usage d’habitation à Sikasso ville et d’autres  ouvrir un magasin de vente.
texts.en:
The ten women of the group Dambe (7 married and 3 unmarried) have an average age of 35 and an average of 3 children.  They live for the most part in polygamous families in Sanoubougou 1, one of the districts of the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy the needs of their customers and are now on their second group loan.  The previous loan was repaid.  Their work involves selling medicines, cloth, condiments, fruit, oil, etc. With their new loan, they intend to buy 4 packages of medicines, 5 packages of condiments, 4 sacks of oranges, 2 boxes of apples, 2 sacks of pineapples, 3 drums of vegetable oil (20 liters each), and 4 bales of cloth.  Supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Sikasso City and in neighboring villages.  Sales are made in Sikasso City in the different marketplaces from fixed spots and throughout the districts by hawking the goods.  Cash is accepted, and sometimes credit, from customers composed of men and women.  The group members each envision realizing a monthly profit of 31,500 francs CFA.  A portion of it will go towards savings and family needs, and the other portion will be invested in business.  Some of the group members intend to buy a plot of land on which to live in Sikasso City and to open a sales store. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Hab's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan for five low-income people who live in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Hab V., 55, has been selected to be group leader by the other members. Hab V. currently sells different kinds of grocery items, to her neighbors who live around the community. She is a single mother blessed with five children, one of whom is married and lives separately, while the others are single. Her husband and her son are fishermen in Tunle Sap Lake.

Hab V. is applying for a loan to restock grocery items to sell. The other borrowers are:

S., who requests a loan to buy additional gear for her fishing business activities;

T., who will be using the loan to buy nets and traps for fishing;

T., a fish catcher, who is looking for a loan to buy more fishing gear;

V. will be using the loan to enlarge her fishing business (she was not available so her husband appears in the picture instead of her).

loans.use: To restock grocery items to sell

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: Josefina R. H. reside en el departamento de San Vicente junto a su esposo, tres hijos y un nieto. Al tener una familia extensa, los gastos de la casa crecen también, y Josefina y su esposo, se encuentran mes a mes con dificultades para mantener el hogar. Josefina, quien maneja un negocio de venta futas y  productos básicos, solicita un préstamo para comprar nueva mercadería para la tienda y así aumentar sus ventas y lograra estabilizar su hogar.
texts.en:
Josefina R. H. lives in the Department of San Vicente, together with her husband, three children and a grandson. With an expanding family, their household expenses have also increased, and Josefina and her husband have found themselves struggling each month to cover the costs of running their home. Josefina operates a business selling fruits and basic products. She is requesting a loan to buy new merchandise for her store, so that she can increase her sales and stabilize her family budget.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding her business inventory

loans.name: Oyunbold

texts.en:
B. Oyunbold is 28 years old and lives with his wife and two-year-old daughter in Uvurkhangai province in central Mongolia. He currently operates a transportation business in his town using his motorcycle. He also owns 10 goats that he raises, together with his father.

Oyunbold bought his motorcycle and started his transportation business in 2008 after leaving his work at a construction company. He is a very business-minded and a hard-working entrepreneur and has quickly found success. In only one year, he made enough money to buy and furnish his own house. He used his remaining profits to buy livestock and meat which he sold at the local market.

For the future, Oyunbold hopes to buy more livestock and continue selling meat, as this has proved profitable for him and the price of livestock is currently decreasing. He is requesting a 300,000 tugrug (approx. 207 USD) loan to purchase sheep and goats to further develop his meat business.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats to further develop his meat business

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es: María Elena P. D. A. resiD. en el municipio D. Armenia del departamento D. Sonsonate. A sus 60 años D. edad, vive con su esposo Sixto, quien le ayuda a administrar un  negocio D. una  tienda D. productos D. consumo, en el mercado D. Armenia. Juntos trabajan diariamente para cubrir sus gastos y subsistir. María Elena y Sixto solicita n un préstamo para surtir su tienda D. mercadería nueva, para darle un empujón a su negocio y mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Maria Elena P. D. A. resides in the municipality of Armenia in the state of Sonsonate. At 60 years of age, she lives with her husband Sixto. He helps her to manage a business, which is a store selling consumer goods at the Armenia market. They work together daily in order to live and cover their expenses. Maria Elena and Sixto request a loan in order to stock their store with new merchandise, so as to give their business a boost and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her business

loans.name: Narzullo

texts.en:
B. Narzullo is 46 years old. He has lived for 20 years with the mother of his three children. His parents taught him the art of cultivating the land and he has always tried to sow his hectares so that he would have a crop in every season.

At this time Narzullo is sowing potatoes and wheat. He says that agricultural work needs much patience and luck, because there are seasons where there is no profit and other seasons are very good but either way he has to keep sowing, profitable or not.

Narzullo is a client who is now working for the third time with IMON International, being very responsible in his payments. He asked for a loan of 2000 USD that will be invested in his crop supplies. Be an important part of the growth of Narzullo’s business!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Airwing Group

texts.en:
Mtezi L., age 23, is single with one daughter of 2 years. He sells second-hand clothes. He started this business 3 years ago and works daily from 8am until 5pm. He is able to earn a monthly profit of around US$ 138.

This will be Mtezi’s 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He hopes for a loan to increase his working capital.

Mtezi will share this loan with his loan group, Airwing, which totals 19 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Mtezi is standing 1st on the right in the back row.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en:
T. Purevsuren is 52-year-old widowed businesswoman who lives with her child in Uvurkhangai province in central Mongolia. Her son attends secondary school.

Until 2000, Purevsuren worked as an assistant doctor until she decided to have her own business. She started selling cosmetics and medicine at the Arvaikheer central market. From that time, as result of her hard work and good customer service, her business has been steadily growing and expanding. She is requesting 2,000,000 tugrugs to purchase more supplies.

loans.use: to purchase more pharmacy supplies
