loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Sabali : 4 femmes mariées, 1 veuve et une célibataire, avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivent dans des  familles polygames à Sanoubougou 1  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur deuxième  prêt de groupe, le précédent  prêt s’est  bien dénoué. 
Elles font comme activités  la vente de médicaments, vêtements pour enfants, condiments alimentaires, fruits, restauration etc.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 5 emballages de médicaments, 4 douzaines d’habits  pour enfants, 5 emballages de condiments alimentaires, 6 sacs d’oranges, 2 cartons de pommes, 3 sacs d’ananas, 1sac de 100kg de riz, 2 sacs d’atiécké et quelques paquets de condiments pour la restauration. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants.
Elles vendent à Sikasso ville dans les marchés à une place fixe et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante. Elles vendent au comptant, souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 35.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Certaines d’entre elles comptent acheter un lot à usage d’habitation à Sikasso ville et d’autres ouvrir un magasin de vente.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers.

loans.name: Mission 7 Namutosi Lydia Group

texts.en: N. Lydia is representing her group. She is twenty years old and a business lady, married with one daughter and she is looking after three dependents who are schooling. She operates a grocery business dealing with fresh foods and vegetables. She is using the loan to purchase fresh foods and vegetables such as bananas, tomatoes, cabbages, among others for sale. She hopes to obtain many things out of her business and also buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase fresh foods and vegetables such as bananas, tomatoes, cabbages, etc.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Soutoura  composé de femmes : 3 mariées et 2 célibataires, avec une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles monogames à Sanoubougou 1,  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative de la république du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur deuxième  prêt de groupe, le premier a été correctement remboursé. 
Elles font comme activités  la vente de pagnes en bazin, des fruits, des tissus et de  l’atiécké dans le cadre de la restauration.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter,  6 emballages de condiments alimentaires, 6 sacs d’oranges, 3 cartons de pommes, 4 sacs d’ananas, 4 balles de tissus,  2 sacs d’atiécké et quelques paquets de condiments pour  la restauration. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants.
Elles vendent à Sikasso ville dans les différents marchés de façon fixe et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante. Elles vendent au comptant, souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 35.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Certaines d’entre elles comptent acheter un lot à usage d’habitation à Sikasso ville et d’autres ouvrir un magasin de vente.

loans.use: Achat de divers articles.

loans.name: Inoyatkhon

texts.en:
I. Inoyatkhon is a 30-year-old mother who does sewing work in a tailor shop to earn money for her children. She started because she likes and loves this trade.

Inoyatkhon is doing her very best to ensure her children of good education and the best future. She wishes that her children can continue with their education. That is the reason that she needs to continue growing her business.

She asks for a loan of 4000 Somoni that will be invested in buying a new sewing machine to increase her production and cover her customers' demands. Help this family improve the quality of their life by contributing to the growth of Inoyatkhon’s business! They will sincerely thank you for it.

loans.use: Purchasing a new modern sewing machine.

loans.name: Radjab

texts.en: Radjab is 57 years old and he makes a living buying and selling livestock. He's married with seven children who he must feed and educate. Over the years Radjab has become very knowledgeable about what is required to raise cattle, their feeding, their calving, etc. It should be noted that, in the past, this man endured hard economic times for a while but he's managed to come through, thanks to the help provided by IMON International. IMON International has granted loans that Radjab has used to buy calves, the reason, too, that he needs this loan now. The loan will greatly improve Radjab’s income and his family's living standards. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more calves

loans.name: Mission 7 Nandutu Juliet Group

texts.en: N. Juliet is twenty-four years old married with one boy child and looking after five dependents schooling. She has been selling milk for over one year. She is using the loan to purchase milk from farms for sell to her customers since most of them are on orders and more new other customers who come to her for milk. She is a hardworking business lady and the chair person of her group. Her future plan is to obtain a cow it self so that with time instead of purchasing milk for sale she will be milking from her cow and sell.

loans.use: To purchase milk from farms for sell to her customers

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
K. Muhabbat, 44 years old, is a mother of 4 children and a real expert in producing traditional national jewelry. She started as an assistant to a goldsmith, gained enough experience, and opened her own shop. She has been in business for 5 years. Muhabbat has successfully borrowed from IMON once, and has proven herself as an honest client. Today Muhabbat requests $700 US Dollars for purchasing materials like precious and semi-precious stones and reagents required for manufacturing the jewelry.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of raw materials like precious and semi-precious stones and reagents required for producing jewelry.

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es: Marta Lidia A. G. reside en el municipio de Ciudad Arce en departamento de La Libertad. Marta de 52 años de edad, es madre soltera y una decidida emprendedora. Sin ninguna educación formal, Marta Lidia, maneja un negocio de tienda de abarrotes que ubicó en su propia casa. Actualmente Marta solicita un préstamo para comprar nueva mercadería y productos, para asegurarse a si misma y a su hijo un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Marta Lidia A. G. lives in the town of Ciudad Arce in the district of La Libertad. She is 52 years old, a single mother, and a determined businesswoman. Without any formal education, Marta Lidia has managed her own grocery store out of her own home.

She is requesting a loan to buy new goods and products so that she can secure a better future for herself and her child.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her business

loans.name: Gloria Cándida

texts.es: Gloria Cándida I. H. reside en Lourdes, municipio dentro  del departamento de La Paz.  Como muchas mujeres del país, Gloria es madre soltera de un hijo menor de edad, a quien cría y mantiene por sí sola. El negocio que Gloria maneja es una pequeña tienda, donde  vende productos de uso básico y diario. Gloria solicita un préstamo para surtir de nuevos productos su negocio y hacer crecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Gloria Cándida I. H. lives in Lourdes, a town located in the district of La Paz. Like many women in her country, Gloria is a single mother of a dependent child that she has to raise and support by herself. She manages a small grocery store where she sells basic products for everyday use. Gloria is requesting a loan so that she can restock her store with new products and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her business

loans.name: Adedoyin

texts.en:
Adedoyin sells foodstuffs and provisions in her shop and has been in this business for five years. She is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell.

Adedoyin is 45 years old and married with seven children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Murat

texts.en:
K. Murat is dedicated to agricultural work, which is his only income to support his family, composed of his wife and five children. He has been dedicated to this business for several years and over time he has gained experience in cultivating crops.

Today, Murat has come to IMON International with the proposition of obtaining a loan to purchase seed and fertilizer for planting. It is necessary to point out that, in order to carry out the first planting, you need to purchase the supplies and it is for this reason that he is confident that his loan request will be successfully granted and he will achieve his objective of having a good harvest to improve his economic situation.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit:  www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Amelia Isabel

texts.es: Amelia Isabel P. M. reside  en Ciudad Arce, municipio en el departamento de La Libertad. Amelia tiene 50 años de edad y vive junto a su madre y su hija Amelia quien aun  se encuentra estudiando. Ser la única trabajadora del hogar y la única fuente de ingresos no es nada fácil, pero Amelia nunca ha perdido la fe ni la inspiración por el trabajo, y administra una venta de frutas y verduras en su casa, para la cual solicita un préstamo, pues le es necesario ampliar su mercadería y productos.
texts.en:
Amelia Isabel P. M. lives in Ciudad Arce, a town in the district of La Libertad. She is 50 years old and lives with her mother and daughter, who is currently a student. Being the only worker in her household and the only source of income is not easy, but Amelia has never lost faith or inspiration for her work. She manages a vending stall selling fruits and vegetables from home.

She is requesting a loan because it is necessary for her to increase her merchandise and the types of products that she offers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory

loans.name: Nasibakhon

texts.en: M. Nasibakhon is 39 years old and is married with four children. Nasibakhon sells dried fruit in the central local market and has been in this business already for eleven years. In Tajikistan people are extremely hospitable. When there are visitors any hostess will serve the table with the national bread, “lepeshka”, tea, candies and dried fruit. Nasibakhon tries to have the wide range of goods and serves her clients with a smile. Her business is stable and generates a considerable income for the family. Today, Nasibakhon requests 5,000 Somoni to purchase dried fruit like raisins, apricots and almonds, as well as pistachios and peanuts to increase her range of goods. Having proved herself as a reliable client, Nasibakhon promises to also repay the current loan in a timely manner. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more dried fruit and nuts

loans.name: Reyna Aracely

texts.es: Reyna Aracely A. M. reside en Soyapango municipio de la capital de El Salvador. Reyna tiene 23 años de edad y vive con su hijo de apenas 4 años y por si esto fuera poco, tiene un nuevo bebe en camino. La idea de tener un nuevo bebe en la casa, llena a Reyna de ilusión y ganas de superarse. Es por esto que solicita un préstamo para mejorar su taller de confección en costuras donde diseñan vestidos y trajes para niñas.
texts.en:
Reyna Aracely A. M. resides in the Soyapango municipality of the capital of El Salvador. Reyna is 23 years old and lives with her son who is just 4 years old and, on top of that, she has a new baby on the way. The idea of having a new baby in the house fills Reyna with hope and the desire to better herself. For this reason she is requesting a loan in order to improve her clothing workshop where she designs dresses and outfits for children.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase raw materials (fabric)

loans.name: Carlos Ernesto

texts.es: Carlos Ernesto C. C. vive en el municipio de Soyapango en el departamento San Salvador. Carlos vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos mayores de edad estudiantes universitarios. El negocio familiar es una librería que hace años, Carlos montó desde su propia casa. El sueno de Carlos siempre fue que sus hijos asistieran a la universidad y recibieran una educación formal, es por eso que solicita un préstamo para ampliar su mercadería, y seguir aportando para la preparación intelectual de sus hijos.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.fr: Monsieur Kokouvi habite le quartier de Sanguéra à Lomé. Il est marié et a 02 enfants à sa charge. Il exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente d’articles d’électricité et de plomberie dans une boutique qu’il a louée. Il exerce cette activité depuis 2007. Cette vente lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.  Il effectue ses achats au Ghana, le pays voisin. Actuellement sa boutique est très bien connue de beaucoup de plombiers et d’électriciens, et même des particuliers. Il vend ses articles en gros et en détail. C’est pour renouveler son stock en état d’épuisement qu’il sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour commander des tuyaux de différentes formes ainsi que des fils électriques, des ampoules, des interrupteurs, des prises électriques et bien d’autres articles importants.
texts.en:
Mr. Kokouvi lives in the Sanguéra district in Lomé.  He is married and has two children in his care.  His income-generating work involves selling electrical and plumbing supplies in his store, which he leased.  He has been in this business since 2007.  His sales enable him to provide for his family.  He makes his purchase in Ghana, the neighboring country.  Currently, his store is very well-known by many plumbers and electricians, and even by private individuals.  He sells his goods wholesale and retail.  To renew his exhausted inventory, he's requesting a WAGES loan to order pipes of different sizes, as well as electrical wire, light bulbs, circuit breakers, electrical plugs, and many other important items. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plumbing and electrical supplies

loans.name: Sharom Group

texts.en:
Furaha K., age 30, is a widower with one daughter of 8 years. He has a clothes business which he started three years ago. He works daily from 7 a.m. until 9 p.m. and is able to earn a monthly profit of around $190.

Furaha hopes for a loan to increase his business. This will be his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. 
	
Furaha will share this loan with his loan group, Sharom, which totals fifteen members. In the photo, Furaha is first from the right in the front row.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to increase his business

loans.name: Saidbuvi

texts.en: Saidbuvi is married and has four children. She has a business selling clothing in the small market of Shahrituz. Her business is going well as demand has been very stable over the last eleven years. Saidbuvi is an entrepreneur of high integrity and is very hardworking and energetic. Even when her competitors have similar products or lower prices, clients naturally gravitate to her as she can skillfully make them feel valued, respected and heard. Saidbuvi is requesting a loan of 5,000 Somoni to purchase seasonal clothing which will help her to continue stabilizing her business and income so that she can support herself and her daughter. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seasonal clothing

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos R. C. reside en el departamento de San Salvador en el municipio de Ilopango. Juan Carlos tiene 27 años de edad y vive con su esposa Marina quien le ayuda en el negocio.  Juntos se dedican a la venta y elaboración de cinchos, que venden luego de manera ambulante en varias zonas de san salvador. Con el propósito de formalizar un poco mas su negocio y vender nuevos productos, Juan Carlos solicita un préstamo que le permita compra materia prima y nuevo inventario.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima para fabricación de cinchos

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Cette dame s’est spécialisée avec le temps, dans la vente de légumes, d’œufs et de macaroni. Elle s’est mariée à un ferrailleur et le couple a 02 enfants. En 2002, elle a pris la ferme résolution de se lancer dans ce commerce parce que les affaires de son mari ne marchaient plus comme avant. Les débuts ont été difficiles pour elle pour s’adapter à cette activité, parce qu’il fallait se lever très tôt pour aller s’approvisionner auprès des maraîchers. A présent elle maîtrise bien ce commerce et est très bien connue dans le marché d’Adidogomé à Lomé. C’est pour constituer des stocks en provision qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter un panier de concombres, 05 sacs de feuilles de salades, 03 paniers de patates douces, 16 plateaux d’œufs et 10 cartons de spaghettis. Elle est convaincue qu’elle remboursera à temps le prêt.
texts.en:
This is a lady who became specialized over time in selling vegetables, eggs, and macaroni.  She is married to a scrap metal dealer, and the couple have two children.  In 2002, she firmly decided to embark on this business because her husband's business was no longer doing as well as before.  It was difficult for her at first to get adjusted to this business because it was necessary to get up very early to go get supplies from market-gardeners.  At present, she has a good command of this commerce and is very well-known at the Adidogomé marketplace in Lomé.  To build up her inventory with provisions, she's requesting a WAGES loan to buy a basket of cucumbers, 5 sacks of salad greens, 3 baskets of sweet potatoes, 16 trays of eggs, and 10 boxes of spaghetti.  She is convinced of repaying the loan on time.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables and a variety of goods

loans.name: Maura Inés

texts.es: Maura Inés P. reside en el municipio de Ciudad Delgado del departamento de San Salvador. Maura de 66 años de edad, vive con su esposo quien trabaja como comerciante. Dese hace cuatro décadas, Maura maneja un puesto en el mercado donde vende zapatos y otros productos. Cada año el negocio crece un poco más, lo que llena de alegría y satisfacción a Maura, es por eso que decidida a continuar creciendo, solicita un préstamo para surtir su negocio con Nuevo inventario que le ayude a vender más.
texts.en:
Maura Inés P. resides in Delgado City, which is located in the San Salvador metropolitan area. Maura is 66 years old, and lives with her husband who works as a merchant. For four decades, Maura has managed a stall in the market where she sells shoes and other products. Every year her business grows a little more, which fills Maura with happiness and satisfaction. For this reason, she is determined to continue to grow her business, requesting a loan in order to stock her business with new inventory, which will help her to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to stock her business with merchandise

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana Gloria M. A. reside en el municipio de Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador. Gloria tiene 52 años de edad, y vive con su hija de 10 años y su padre Don Pedro de 83 años de edad. Debido a la avanzada edad de Don Pedro, Ana Gloria lo cuida y mantiene. Ana maneja un taller de costura y venta al por mayor, donde trabaja el día entero y se gana la vida.  En este momento solicita un préstamo para comprar materia prima y nuevos materiales para expandir su negocio y crecer comercialmente.
texts.en:
Ana Gloria M. A. resides in the municipality of Apopa, in the San Salvador area. Gloria is 52 years old, and lives with her 10-year old daughter and her 83-year old father Don Pedro. Since Don Pedro is of advanced age, Ana Gloria supports and cares for him. Ana manages a clothing workshop and wholesale business, where she works the entire day to earn her living. She is currently requesting a loan in order to purchase raw materials and new material in order to expand her business and grow commercially.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase raw materials

loans.name: Ana Maricela

texts.es: Ana Maricela M. M. reside en San Rafael Obrajuelos ubicado en el departamento de La Paz. Ana tiene 51 años de edad, y vive con su hija y su  madre Victoria de 80 años de edad. Ana Maricela cuida y mantiene de ambas trabajando en un  negocio de chalet ubicado en  una escuela de la zona. Ana Maricela y su familia solicitan un préstamo para surtir de nuevos productos al chalet y así ofrecer una mejor gama de productos que le ayuden a vender y ganar mejor.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio

loans.name: Omolayo

texts.en:
Omolayo sells plastics and cooking utensils like pots, plates, etc. She also sells hair extensions. She started this business nine years ago.

Omolayo hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more hair extensions and plastics to sell. She is 40 years old and married with three children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: María Julia

texts.es: María Julia H. D. L. resiD. en la capital del país, junto a su esposo y sus dos. María se dedica a la elaboración  D. comida y platillos típicos, los cuales cocina y prepara desD. su casa. Al iniciar el negocio, María Julia ni siquiera podía cocinar, pero la necesidad y el esfuerzo, la han convertido en una exitosa cocinera y administradora. María Julia solicita un préstamo para comprar materia prima y así reinvertir en su negocio que tanta alegría le ha brindado  a ella y a su familia.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Elyse

texts.fr: Cette dame a ouvert une grande boutique de vente de pagnes de qualité. Elle a ouvert sa boutique l’année dernière grâce à l’aide financière de son mari. Sa boutique se situe dans le quartier de Baguida à Lomé. Elle s’approvisionne le plus souvent au Grand Marché de Lomé. Actuellement elle dispose de beaucoup de vendeuses ambulantes, ce qui fait qu’elle arrive à vite écouler son stock. Beaucoup de femmes fonctionnaires et même les grandes femmes d’affaire de la capitale viennent faire leur choix de pagnes dans sa boutique. Elle a un réel besoin de renouveler son stock en ce moment ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 46 pièces de pagnes de qualité Hitarget, 02 pièces de pagnes de qualité moyenne Lessi, 15 pièces de pagnes Bazin. Elle est mère d’un enfant.
texts.en:
This lady opened a large store selling quality pagnes (colorful West African cloth).  She opened it last year, thanks to her husband's financial help.  Her store is located in the Baguida district in Lomé.  She usually stocks up at the Grand Market of Lomé.  Currently she has many saleswomen going door-to-door, which means she manages to sell her inventory quickly. Many women civil servants and even the major business women in the capital come to her store and have their choice.  At present, she has a real need to replenish her stock.  For this reason, she's requesting a WAGES loan to buy 46 bolts of quality Hitarget pagnes, 2 bolts of medium quality Lessi pagnes, and 15 bolts of Bazin pagnes.  She is the mother of one child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy quality cloth

loans.name: Adzovi Mawusé

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Adzovi vend uniquement des bijoux de qualité. Elle a débuté ce commerce depuis 2007 dans le marché de Gbossimé à Lomé. Cette activité lui permet surtout de subvenir à ses propres besoins. Elle se rend au Bénin, mais parfois au Ghana pour s’approvisionner en bijoux de qualité, pour se différencier de la concurrence. Cette situation fait qu’elle dispose de clients disposant financièrement des moyens pour effectuer des achats de valeur. Pour anticiper une éventuelle pénurie de bijoux, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour lancer sa nouvelle commande. Elle compte sur le pouvoir d’achat élevé de sa clientèle pour vite rembourser le prêt. Elle est célibataire et sans enfant.
texts.en:
Ms. Adzovi sells quality jewelry exclusively.  She started this business in 2007 at the Gbossimé marketplace in Lomé.  This business enables her in particular to support herself.  She goes to Benin, and sometimes to Ghana, to stock up on quality jewelry in order to differentiate herself from the competition.  As a result, she has customers of means who make high-value purchases.  In anticipation of a possible shortage of jewelry, she's requesting a WAGES loan to start ordering anew.  She is counting on the elevated buying power of her customers to repay the loan quickly.  She is unmarried and has no children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy quality jewelry

loans.name: Try And See Group

texts.en:
"Try and see" is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Jerry S., living in Rock Town, Water Street, a populated market area in Monrovia, Liberia. Jerry is not married and doesn’t have any children. He is an 11th grade drop-out due to poverty.

Jerry’s business is clothing, buying clothes wholesale and selling them retail to his customers in Waterside. He has been running his business for 3 years. His dream is to grow his business until he can build a larger permanent shop. He is taking the loan to buy additional clothing wholesale to serve his customers. With the profits from his business, Jerry dreams of sending his children to school and building a house of his own.

loans.use: To buy more clothing wholesale to expand his business

loans.name: Messanh Koffi

texts.fr: Ce jeune homme fait parti des premières personnes qui très tôt se sont lancées dans l’activité de taxi-moto dans la ville de Lomé, au lendemain de la grève générale qu’a connu le pays. Il a donc débuté cette activité génératrice de revenus en 2000. Actuellement bien qu’il soit toujours conducteur de cet engin à deux roues, il dispose à son actif de 02 autres motos, qu’il a confiées à 02 conducteurs sous contrat. C’est pour acheter une troisième moto qu’il sollicite un crédit de WAGES dans le but d’agrandir ses capacités d’exploitation. Ce jeune homme n’est pas marié et n’a aucun enfant à sa charge. Il a une très bonne capacité de gestion et compte sur sa rigueur et son pragmatisme pour rembourser le prêt dans les délais exigés.
texts.en:
This young man was one of the first people who, very soon after the general strike that the country of Togo experienced, set out in the moto-taxi business in the town of Lomé. He started this income-generating business in 2000. Now, still the driver of the two-wheeled vehicle, he also has 2 other motorbikes that he entrusts to 2 drivers under contract. He is asking for this money from WAGES so that he can buy a third motorbike, with the aim of expanding his operational capacity. This young man is unmarried and has no dependent children. He has great management capabilities and is relying upon his rigour and pragmatism to repay the loan within the given timeframe.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Like most Filipina housewives, Anita T. doesn’t want her time to be idle. Anita lives with her husband Facundo in a small rented place in Facundo St., Pasay City. She is 38 years old.

Anita owns a 'sari-sari' (general) store but she makes a lot of earnings from her direct selling business. She gets cosmetics and apparel from prominent companies (Avon, Sarah Lee, Board Walk, etc.) on consignment and passes them to customers on the installment basis. At times, Anita also provides home-based manicure and pedicure services to clients. All these activities guarantee her more than P20,000 a month in earnings.

Anita joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative only last year but is already enjoying her stay with fellow women entrepreneurs. Anita needs a loan in the amount of P 15,000. She wants to buy a refrigerator for her general store so she can offer cold drinks and other refreshments to her neighbors who come to shop. She will also use some of the funds to buy more products to sell at her store.

Anita wishes that all her children be able to manage college.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator for her general store

loans.name: Adjo Akpénè

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier d’Awatamé à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Mais en 2000, elle a été traumatisée par le décès subit de son mari. Cette veuve était obligée de subvenir seule aux besoins de ses enfants et d’assurer leur éducation scolaire. Cette contrainte imprévisible l’a donc poussée à ouvrir une boutique de vente des produits de mercerie et des tissus légers. Heureusement que cette activité connaît un réel succès ; puisqu’elle arrive à payer son loyer et à régler ses fournisseurs. C’est pour pouvoir reconstituer son stock manquant qu’elle voudrait avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter un bal de tissus légers, des rubans, des fils à coudre, des fils de surfilage, des épingles et des boutons. Elle n’a aucun souci pour rembourser son prêt à temps.
texts.en:
This is a lady who lives in the Awatamé district of Lomé.  She is married and the mother of five children.  But in 2000, she was traumatized by the sudden death of her husband.  Alone, this widow was compelled to provide for her children's needs and to ensure they are educated. This unforeseeable constraint therefore drove her to open a store, which sells sewing supplies and light-weight fabrics.  Fortunately, this business has really been successful, since she manages to pay her rent and her suppliers.  To be able to replenish her low inventory, she would like to obtain a WAGES loan to buy a bale of light-weight fabrics, some ribbons, sewing thread, overcasting thread, needles, and buttons.  She is not worried at all about repaying her loan on time. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth and sewing supplies

loans.name: Ewoe Judith

texts.fr: Cette dame n’est pas mariée et n’a aucun enfant à sa charge. Elle a appris le métier de coiffure. En 2004, elle a ouvert son atelier de coiffure dans le quartier de Totsi à Lomé. Avec le temps, par rapport à la fidélité de ses clients, elle a commencé aussi à vendre des mèches et tissages pour apporter une valeur ajoutée à ses activités. Elle se rend très souvent au Grand Marché de Lomé pour s’approvisionner en mèches et tissages. Actuellement elle a une clientèle bien remplie ; aussi pour mieux répondre à leurs attentes, elle a recruté une apprenti coiffeuse. Pour renouveler son stock, elle sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour acheter 50 mèches Nina, 50 mèches Curly, 50 mèches Ondulées et des tissages de différentes gammes. Elle est fière de son activité.
texts.en:
This is an unmarried lady with no children at all to support.  She has learned hairdressing as a trade.  In 2004, she opened her hair salon in the Totsi district of Lomé.  Over time, with regard to the loyalty of her customers, she also started to sell hair extensions and weaves to bring added value to her business.  She often goes to the Grand Market of Lomé to stock up on hair extensions and weaves.  At present, has has very busey customers; and to respond further to their expectations, she has recruited an apprentice hairdresser.  To renew her stock of merchandise, she's requesting a WAGES loan to buy 50 Nina hair extensions, 50 Curly hair extensions, 50 Ondulées hair extensions, and some weaves in different ranges.  She is proud of her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and weaves to sell

loans.name: West Life Group

texts.en:
'West Life' is a group of 5 borrowers led by Gabriel M. living on 20th Street, Sinkor, in a community in Monrovia, Liberia where mixed poor and middle-class people live. Gabriel is a single man with no children. Due to the civil conflict here in Liberia, he became an 11th grade drop-out.

Gabriel’s business is transportation (driving commercial motorbikes) in downtown Monrovia, Liberia.First he started with rice sales but later realized that the people of Monrovia suffer transportation problems, so he decided that was his chance to make some money to improve his life. He’s been running this business for 3 months. Gabriel feels that looking decent while riding attracts customers. Gabriel is very determined and hard-working. He needs this loan to get new motorbikes to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy more commercial motorcycles to improve business

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Cette femme s’est spécialisée dans le commerce de tubercules, plus précisément d’ignames. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 2004 à Lomé dans son quartier d’Agbalépédogan. En plus de la vente d’ignames à la devanture de sa maison, elle vend aussi les soirs des frites d’ignames que savourent beaucoup de personnes ; ces frites sont appelées localement « koliko ». Pour s’approvisionner en ignames, elle se rend le plus souvent dans le Nord du Togo, à Bassar situé à une centaine de kilomètres de Lomé. Elle se rend à Bassar parce que les meilleures ignames du pays se trouvent dans cette localité. C’est pour lancer une nouvelle commande q’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES  pour acheter un taxi-bagages d’ignames ; le prêt servira également à s’approvisionner en condiments, en huile et acheter 05 sacs de charbons de bois pour la préparation de koliko. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant.
texts.en:
This is a woman who specializes in the commerce of tubers, yams to be exact.  She has been in this business since 2004 in Lomé in her district of Agbalépédogan.  In addition to selling yams in front of her house, she sells fried yams in the evenings that many people savor;  these fries are called koliko locally.  To supply herself with yams, she usually goes to northern Togo, in Bassar, located about 100 km from Lomé.  She goes to Bassar because the best yams in the nation are found in the area.  To start a new order for goods, she's requesting a WAGES loan to buy a luggage-taxi of yams;  the loan will also be used to stock up on condiments and oil and to buy 5 sacks of charcoal for making koliko.  She is married and the mother of one child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy yams and condiments for cooking

loans.name: Ayabavi

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Ayabavi est une coiffeuse de profession. Elle a ouvert son atelier de coiffure en 2005 dans le quartier de Baguida à Lomé. Elle arrive à satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle. Elle maîtrise les nouvelles coiffures à la mode, ce qui fait que sa clientèle est essentiellement constituée des jeunes dames et jeunes filles. Elle en profite pour vendre aussi des mèches de qualité qu’elle achète au Grand Marché de Lomé. Actuellement elle manque énormément de séchoir à main ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES. Le prêt servira également a acheter 35 mèches de différentes qualités. Cette jeune fille est célibataire et sans enfant.
texts.en:
Ms. Ayabavi is a hairdresser by profession.  She opened her hair salon in 2005 in the Baguida district in Lomé.  She manages to satisfy her customers.  She has a command of new hair styles, which means that her customers are essentially young ladies and girls.  She takes advantage of this by also selling quality hair extensions, which she purchases from the Grand Market of Lomé.  At present, she has an enormous need for a hand-held hair dryer;  for this reason, she's requesting a WAGES loan.  The loan will also be used to buy 35 hair extensions of various qualities. This girl is unmarried and has no children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an automatic hair dryer and some hair extensions

loans.name: Mireille

texts.en: Mireille is a 32-year-old married woman living with her husband and 2 children. In 2006 she decided to open her own store where she produces packaging and decoration for chocolates. Today, Mireille is requesting to borrow $1,100 to purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ukakamavu Group

texts.en:
J. Mandwi, age 55, is married with eight children.  He has a secretarial bureau,  sells VC, DVD, and video cassettes.  He started this business 2years ago and works daily from 8am until 6pm. He is able to earn a monthly profit of around $100. 

This will be J.’s 1st loans from Tujijenge Tanzania. He hopes to increase on his business and to buy a second hand computer.
	
J. will share this loan with his loan group, Ukakamavu, which totals 21 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, J. is 1st on the left front row in white.

loans.use: To buy a second hand and increase on his business

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en: Fadi is a 46-year-old married man. In 2005 he decided to open his own business called 'Fadi's Salon' where he works as a hair dresser for the neighboring areas. Today, he is hoping to borrow $1,000 to redecorate the shop to be able to attract a langer range of clientele.

loans.use: to redecorate the shop

loans.name: United Brothers #2 Group

texts.en:
United Brothers #2 is a group of 5 borrowers led by Solomon B., 36 years old, a high school graduate and also a single parent of an 11-month-old baby. Solomon lives on Clay Street, a very crowded neighbourhood where people feel they are not a part of the world because of poverty and hardship.

Solomon’s business is tailoring. He sews clothes for people and gets paid. He started this business sewing for customers 4 years ago, and by sewing good clothes and on time, he started improving from one step to another. He wishes in the future to own a clothing factory. His dreams are to improve his own and his child’s life and live in better conditions. He needs the loan to buy more textiles to sew more clothing for customers.

loans.use: To buy more clothing textiles to serve customers

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 20-year-old single man living with his parents and three siblings. He has been working as a blacksmith for the past two years when he had to start helping with the family income. Today, Ibrahim is requesting to borrow US$ 1,000 to improve his business through the purchase of needed merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Musoto Nelima Petwa Group

texts.en: N. Petwa is Musoto group’s chairperson; she is aged thirty-three years and married with three children all going to school and looking after six dependents. She deals with local brew business which she has been selling for over ten years. She is using the loan to purchase maize flour, millet, and yeast for formation of local brew and more so she buys crates of beer, sodas, water, etc to cater for the demands of her customers. She is a promising lady whose dream is to construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, millet, and yeast for formation of local brew and more so she buys crates of beer, sodas, water, etc to cater for the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 51-year-old widow who lives with her child. Twenty years ago, she started in agriculture and, in 2000, she purchased her own land and started growing tobacco and seasonal trees.Today, Fatmeh wants to borrow $1,000 to improve her business and increase its productivity.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Progressive Group

texts.en:
"Progressive" is a group of 5 borrowers led by Anna N.. Anna is married and has 5 children, ages 6 - 23 years old, with educational levels ranging from 1st-12th grade. Anna is an illiterate due to an early marriage. She lives on Randal Street, a popular commercial street in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. 

Anna buys textiles wholesale and sells them retail to the residents of Randall Street. She started with few textiles, but she was determined to make this business grow because her profit put food on the table for her and her family. She has been running this business for 20 years and hopes to expand it to a very high level. 

She need this loan to add to her capital and get more goods to reach a high level in business. Anna feels that her positive approach to customers made her succeed thus far. Her dreams are for her and the family to become successful and change their lives completely.

loans.use: Purchase more clothing textiles to acquire more profit

loans.name: Mpumude Cell Buwule Marjoria Group

texts.en:
Buwule M. is the chairperson of her loan group. She is a 45-year-old businesswoman. She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school. She also cares for two dependents who go to school. 

M. operates a beauty salon. She has been in this business for over five years. She is requesting a loan to purchase beauty salon items, such as chemicals, hair weaving items, hair foods, hair treatments, etc. She wants to attract customers from different corners to come and support her business because she has good skills in the salon business. Her future hope is to educate her children and be able to care for her family well.

loans.use: To purchase beauty salon items such as chemicals, hair weaving, hair foods, hair treatments, etc.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane T. was born in 1963. She has graduated from the State Engineering Institute of Armenia. Gayane and her husband, Eduard, have a daughter who studies at the Yerevan State Conservatory. 

Gayane and her husband, who appear together in the photo, have a common business. The family has been renting a place at the largest Yerevan Fair since the very first days of its opening in 1992. They sell men’s clothing: suits, leather jackets, shirts, trousers, ties, and socks. Gayane needs $3000 to change the assortment of clothing that she sells from summer to winter wear.

loans.use: To buy winter clothes to sell

loans.name: Salman

texts.en: Salman is a 36-year-old single man living with his parents and 2 siblings. In 2004 he decided to open his own clothing shop called "Extrim". Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 in order to purchase inventory for his shop.

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Akkajja-Omunaku Rehema Musiogi Group

texts.en:
Rehema M. is forty-five years old and married. She has five children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of three dependents who are in school. 

Rehema sells produce, such as matooke (bananas). She has been in this business for five years. She will use her loan to purchase more produce to sell. She is a hard-working businesswoman who is willing to improve her business and prosper. She dreams about building a house.

loans.use: To purchase produce, such as bananas (matooke), to sell

loans.name: Jamale

texts.en: Jamale is a 47-year-old married woman. Twenty years ago when she was newly married, she opened her own business selling beauty products and clothes. Today, she is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Little Is Much When God Is In It. Group

texts.en:
"Little Is Much When God Is In It" is a group of 5 borrowers led by Mako T. T.. Mako is a 34-year-old high school graduate and a single parent of 2 children ages 8 and 14, who are both in 4th grade. Mako lives between Mechlin and Water Streets, a community that is known for small businesses, in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. 

Mako buys clothing wholesale and sells it retail to the residents of downtown Monrovia. Because she is a single parent, she takes her clothing business very seriously. She needs this loan to buy more clothing to make a profit in order to educate her kids.

Mako sells good material. That makes her win more customers. She has been running this business for 15 years. She wants to import clothing from abroad to make it cheaper and affordable even for poor people to buy. Her dream is to change her live and the life of her family through her business.

loans.use: Buy more clothing

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim N. is thirty years old. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She also cares for another dependent who goes to school. 

She operates a retail shop where she has been selling cosmetics and water for over ten years. She is using the loan to purchase cosmetics, water, etc to sell. She is a determined entrepreneur whose dream is to obtain a grinding machine for maize so she can manufacture maize flour and supply it to the markets.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, water, etc for sale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace N. is a forty-eight-year-old widow. She has four children in school and she cares for two other siblings who also go to school. 

She is using the loan to purchase retail shop items, such as flour, drinks, bread, soap, sugar, and salt, to sell. She is a hardworking and encouraged businesswoman who dreams about building a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase retail shop items to sell.

loans.name: Afaf

texts.en: Afaf is a 62-year-old woman living with her 6 siblings. She has owned her own lingerie shop for the past 10 years where she services the neighboring villages. Today, Afaf is requesting to borrow $800 to increase her purchases to be able to keep up with the demand of the market.

loans.use: to increase her purchases

loans.name: Achraf

texts.en: Achraf is a 37-year-old married man who lives with his wife and 2 children. In 2008, he opened his own own dry cleaning shop and named it "Mister Clean." Today, Achraf is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase two additional washing machines and a dryer.

loans.use: To purchase two additional washing machines and a dryer

loans.name: United Sisters Group

texts.en:
"United Sisters" is a group of  5 borrowers led by Hawa S.. Hawa is 32 years old and a 5th-grade drop-out due to poverty. She’s also a single mother of 4 children, ages  5 - 14 years, in kindergarten through 7th grade. Hawa lives in the Airfield Lakpazee area, a community that is a little far from downtown Monrovia, Liberia, but is a poor community. Many people leave rural areas like Lofa County to settle there.

Hawa sells dried meat and fish. She started this business by going out of town to the rural areas to buy her products, and then bringing them to town to sell in the Lakpazee Market to residents of Lakpazee. She has been running this business for 13 years and wants to improve it. Therefore, she need a loan to purchase more dried meat and fish so she can make more profit and make her dream of success come to pass.

Hawa always dries her fish and meat the perfect way to attract customers, because there are so many competing vendors in the Lakpazee Market.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish and meat

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 26-year-old married man living with his wife and child. He has owned his own car body shop for the past year with 5 years of experience.Today, Ali is hoping to borrow $1,200 in order to purchase needed tools for his business.

loans.use: to purchase needed tools for his business

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 48-year-old divorced man who lives with his 2 children. He has owned his own metal shop since 1974 when he first learned the business. Today, Mohamad is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a new machine.

loans.use: To purchase a new machine

loans.name: Akkajja Omunaku Nabojjo Lonah Group

texts.en:
Lonah N. is forty-five years old. She is married and has seven children. She also cares for four dependents, three of whom go to school. 

Lonah has been selling rice for over three years. She is requesting a loan to add capital to her rice business so she can increase her stock and her profits. She is a promising, hard-working businesswoman whose dream is to construct a house.

loans.use: To buy rice

loans.name: Blessed Family Group

texts.en:
"Blessed Family" is a group of 5 borrowers led by Deddeh B.. Deddeh is 50 years old. She is married and has 8 children, ages 12 - 35 years .She didn’t go to school. She grew up in rural Lofa County, where most women are not educated because they believe they don’t need to educate women. Instead, the women rely on their husbands to care for the entire family. 

She lives in the Fiamah neighborhood in the north of Monrovia. It is a poor community that is not comfortable to live in because there is no electricity or piped-in water, and they live in small, tight houses. Families in this neighborhood are fed for about $1.50 a day.

Deddeh sells charcoal. She buys wood in the rural area and burns it to make charcoal. Then she brings the charcoal to Monrovia and supplies the residents of Fiamah. Charcoal is the most popular cooking fuel in Liberia.

She started this business with a small amount of charcoal, but because Deddeh's charcoal is burnt very well and her human relations are so good, her business increased from one level to another. She has been in this business for 4 years and still wants to improve by owning a shop. She will use the loan she‘s applying for to burn more charcoal and acquire more profit, because her dream is for her and her family to become successful.

loans.use: To purchase more wood for charcoal

loans.name: Mercy Kakayi Martha Group

texts.en:
Martha K. is a widow who is forty years old. She is blessed with two children and looks after five other dependents, all of whom are in school. 

Martha has run a restaurant for over ten years. She now employs 3 waitresses and 2 cooks to assist her in running the business smoothly. She will not forget how hard it was to started the restaurant on her own. She thanks God that her Kiva loan is serving as instrument to sustain her business. 

She wants to expand her daily food menu to meet customers' preferences for dining in and to repair and improve the restaurant building to accommodate travelers stopping over for meals. She is a hard-working businesswoman whose dream is to buy sewing machines so that she can start a side business to generate extra income.

loans.use: To expand her menu, and repair and improve the building

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Hernan, es artesano, trabaja elaborando calzados en una pequeña microempresa, es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene para poder solventar los gastos familiares.
Vive en la zona Alto Llojeta de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa alquilada
El crédito será destinado para salud (tratamiento medico y análisis general, pues no se siente bien).
Es primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, con este crédito podremos ayudarle para que pueda mejorarse de su salud ya que tiene problemas de hígado y con un  tratamiento estará mejor para poder trabajar, y apoyar en los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
Hernan is an artisan. He works crafting footwear at a small microenterprise. This is the only source of income he has for defraying his family expenses. He lives in the Alto Llojeta area of the city of La Paz, where he rents a house. The loan is intended for healthcare (medical treatment, and a general evaluation, for he does not feel well).

This is the first time he requests a loan at Impro. With this loan we will be able to help him improve his health. He has liver problems and with a treatment he will get better and be able to work and take care of his family’s expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of personal medical analysis and treatment.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
Ignacio tiene un vehiculo que trabaja en el Sindicato San Cristóba, su esposa es empleada domestica.
Vive en la zona Ovejuyo sur de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa propia
El crédito será destinado para capital de Inversión  (Reparación general del motor y tapizado de los asientos y laterales)
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente bueno en el pago de sus cuotas; con este crédito tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar sus ingresos y condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Ignacio operates a vehicle for the San Cristóba trade union. His wife works as a maid. He lives in his own home in the Ovejuyo district, which is south of the city of La Paz.

This loan will be used as operating capital to overhaul the engine and reupholster the seats and side interiors of his vehicle.

This is the second time Ignacio has requested a loan from IMPRO. His payment history qualifies him as a good client. With this loan, he will have the opportunity to improve his earnings and living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for engine repairs & upholstery for his vehicle

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene vive en la avenida Francisco Areas Valencia de la zona  Mariscal Sucre en la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive junto a su esposa la cual trabaja con como ayudante en la misma movilidad, y su pequeña hija. 

El trabaja como chofer propietario de servicio publico en su minibus en una de las líneas centrales de la ciudad.

El crédito lo destinará para la reparación del motor,  ya que por el constante uso presenta fallas mecánicas. 
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.

loans.use: Costo de reparación del motor de su minibus.

loans.name: Willy

texts.es:
Willy  vive en la calle Luis Espinal  de la zona Rio Seco en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive en casa Propia, su familia vive en el interior del país. 

Trabaja como artesano en la reparación de calzados en su pequeño kiosco ubicado en la misma zona.
 
 El crédito lo destinará para la adquisición de una maquina de costura para cuero y así mejorar la atención de sus clientes, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Willy lives on Luis Espinal Street in the district of Rio Seco in the city of El Alto. He lives in his own home with his family in the countryside.

He works as a cobbler repairing shoes from his small kiosk located in the same area. His loan will be used to acquire a sewing machine for leather so that he can improve the service he provides to his customers and increase his income.

This is Willy’s first loan with IMPRO. His evaluation indicates he is qualified for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a machine for sewing leather

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: LA SEÑORA CARMEN YA ESTA EN SU 3º SECUENCIA, ELLA ES MUY RESPONSABLE EN SUS PAGOS, NO TIENE NINGUN DIAS DE MORA. SU NEGOCIO ES LA VENTA DE GANGOCHOS (BOLSAS, ENVASES DE POLIPROPILENO), ELLA CUENTA CON CLIENTES FIJOS QUE LE COMPRAN TANTO DEL MERCADO CAMPESINO COMO DE OTROS MERCADOS, SU ESPOSO LE AYUDA A DISTRIBUIR LOS PEDIDOS, SE DEDICA A ESTE NEGOCIO DESDE HACE 5 AÑOS, VIVE EN CASA PROPIA.
texts.en:
Carmen is in her third loan; she's very responsible with her payments and has never been late. Her business entails selling "gangochos" (propylene bags and containers). She has steady customers at the community market, as well as in other markets. Her husband helps her distribute the orders. Carmen has been in this business for five years; she owns her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying propylene bags

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela vive en el manzano “O”  de la zona Rio Seco   de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive junto a su madre y sus dos hijas, ya que por circunstancias de la vida tuvo que separarse de su esposo.

Graciela es una persona muy activa, ya que trabaja como profesora de nivel primario en el turno de la mañana, el resto del día lo dedica a la confección de buzos deportivos trabajo que lo realiza con la colaboración de su madre y su hija.


El crédito lo destinará  como capital de trabajo, en la adquisición de materia prima (telas para buzos)  y así aumentar su producción. 
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro  la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Graciela lives in section “O” of the Rio Seco district in the city of El Alto. She lives with her mother and her two daughters. Due to life’s circumstances, she had to separate from her husband.

Graciela is a very active person. She works in the morning as an elementary school teacher. For the remainder of the day, she manufactures sportswear along with her mother and daughter.

This loan will be used as working capital to purchase materials for making sportswear, thereby increasing her production.

This is Graciela’s first loan with IMPRO. Her evaluation indicates she is qualified to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, zippers, and elastic for making sportswear

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe vive en la C.  “3” de la zona  Puerto Mejillones de la ciudad de El Alto

Vive con su esposa y sus hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar, en la casa de sus familiares, como cuidadores. 

El posee un camion con el cual trabaja como distribuidor en una empresa de elaboración de refrescos.
 
El crédito lo destinará para la reparación del motor de su movilidad, ya que  actualmente presenta fallas mecánicas que le impide realizar sus jornadas de trabajo completas. 
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.

loans.use: Costo de mantenimiento y reparación del motor de su camión repartidor de refrescos.

loans.name: Belter

texts.es:
Belter vive en la avenida Illimani de la zona  San Roque ubicado en una zona periférica  de la ciudad de El Alto. 
Vive junto a su esposa, la cual se dedica a la costura de ropa deportiva en su pequeño taller en su domicilio. 

El trabaja como chofer propietario de servicio publico en su minibus  en una de las rutas de la ciudad.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de motor y caja de cambios que se encuentran en mal estado por el constante uso, su minibus presenta fallas mecánicas que le impide realizar sus jornadas de trabajo completas. 
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.

loans.use: Compra de motor y caja de cambios para su minibus de transporte de pasajeros.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando vive en la calle “5” de la zona  Plan autopista de la ciudad de La Paz

Vive en casa de sus padres,  su esposa se dedica al cuidado de su pequeña hijas como ama de casa. 

El trabaja como chofer propietario de servicio publico en su automóvil en una de las líneas centrales de la ciudad.

El crédito lo destinará para la reparación del motor y otros accesorios de su vehiculo,  ya que por el constante uso presenta fallas mecánicas que le impide realizar sus jornadas de trabajo completas. 
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Rolando lives on #5 Street in the Plan Autopista district of the city of La Paz. He lives in the house of his parents. His wife is a homemaker who cares for their young daughters.

Rolando works as a private driver. He provides public transport services in his automobile on one of the central routes in the city.

This loan will be used to pay for motor repairs and other accessories for his vehicle. Constant mechanical failures prevent him from working full days.

This is Rolando’s second loan with IMPRO. His evaluation indicates he is qualified to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for motor repairs & purchase accessories for his vehicle

loans.name: Cecilia Del Carmen

texts.es: Cecilia Del Carmen  V. D. A. vive en el departamento D. La Paz junto a su familia, que está conformada por su esposo y sus tres hijos menores D. edad, quienes se encuentran estudiando. Cecilia posee su propio negocio, el cual le permite ayudar a su esposo en los múltiples gastos familiares, el negocio D. Cecilia consiste en la elaboración y venta D. pupusas, cuenta con una clientela ya estable, pero Cecilia quiere fortalecer mas su pupuseria con este crédito, que le ayudara a comprar mayor cantidad D. materia prima, para lograr aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Cecilia Del Carmen V. D. A. lives in the district of La Paz with her family, which consists of her husband and their three dependent children who are students. She has her own business, which enables her to help husband with multiple family expenses.

Cecilia’s business involves making and selling pupusas. She has a steady clientele, but she wants to make more improvements to her pupuseria. With this loan, she will buy more ingredients to help increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es: La señora Felicidad, es un cliente relativamente nueva que ya trabajo mas de cuatro secuencias  con la institución y demostro responsabilidad y puntualidad, al momento de la visita demostro que tiene buena actitud y buen caracter el cliente, la Señora Felicidad se dedica a la venta de articulos de ferreteria, ella tiene su puesto fijo en la feria de la 16 de julio; esta feria se da los dias jueves y domingo, pero ella no solo vende los dias jueves y domingo sino distribuye de forma ambulante en las diferentes ferias de El Alto, la señora compra los articulos de ferreteria por mayor y ella los vende al detalle. Su esposo Martin Mamani Matha se dedica a la albañileria,los trabajos que su esposos realiza son eventuales, la pareja actualmente tiene dos hijos sus dos hijos estan en colegio. La Sra. Felicidad invertira el préstamo en la compra articulos de ferreteria por mayor.

loans.use: Invertira el credito en la compra de herrramientas por mayor

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen M. D.
texts.en: Carmen M. D.

loans.use: To stock her store.

loans.name: West Life Group

texts.en:
"West Life" is a group of 5 borrowers led by Evelyn D.. Evelyn is 30 years old and single. She has a seventeen-year old-son and she also cares for another child. Evelyn's dream of education sank due to the civil crisis in Liberia. She was forced to drop out of junior high school. She lives in the 19th Street Sinkor, a community close to downtown Monrovia.

Evelyn sells dry goods, such as rice, beans, bonnie (dried fish), cubes, and oil, to the residents of Sinkor. She started this business 6 years ago, with Ld$3000, which is about $50 USD. Evelyn kept her head high and her focus on her business because it is the only thing she can depend on to feed her family.

Evelyn’s good relationships with her customers made her succeed this much. She needs this loan to purchase more food to expand her business. Evelyn’s goal is to grow to the level of a shop and even bigger. And her dream is for her and her family to become successful.

loans.use: To purchase more food to sell

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: Juan Alberto E. reside en San Pedro Masahuat en el departamento de La paz. Juan tiene 69 años de edad, vive con su hijo Jaime de 32 años que trabaja como albañil. Para Juan ha sido muy difícil sostener a su familia ya que no cuenta con ninguna educación escolar pero esto no fue obstáculo para que Juan iniciara su negocio de ventas de billetes de lotería, que con un poco de suerte y mayores sean sus ventas de billetes, mayores ganancias obtiene, ahora Juan solicita este crédito por que quiere comprar más billetes de lotería para comercializar y poder lograr mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan Alberto resides in San Pedro in the Department of Peace. Juan is 69 years old and he lives with his 32 year old son Jaime who works as a brick layer. For Juan it has been very difficult to support his family without any formal education but this was no obstacle for Juan to begin his business of selling lottery tickets. With a little luck and an increase in the sales of tickets, his earnings will increase. Now Juan requests this credit because he wants to buy more lottery tickets to commercialize and to achieve greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Tess Siemer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more lottery tickets to sell

loans.name: Inocente

texts.es: El señor Inocente T. vive con su esposa la señora Ana Luisa González quien esta al cuidado de su hogar y de su familia, el señor labora para una empresa de bebidas desde hace 5 años en el puesto de chofer, el y su esposa están solicitando este crédito para la compra de uniformes escolares y materiales didácticos para su hija que está en edad escolar, ya que la quieren preparar para un buen futuro.

loans.use: Compra de utiles escolares y uniformes

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Picota”, Distrito de Picota, Provincia de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 41 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que ya no dependen de ella.

El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de Anticuchos, ubicada en la Plaza de Armas de su Ciudad, donde hay mucho movimiento y poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad. 
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio donde vende diariamente  por las noches. Nos cuenta que esta muy contenta y satisfecha con su  negocio y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará insumos como arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad y remplazar a los antiguos.

Isabel, se siente muy tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.

loans.use: Comprará insumos, para preparar sus alimentos.

loans.name: Amadith

texts.es:
La señora Amadith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Picota”, Distrito de Picota, Provincia de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 48 años y todos sus hijos ya son independientes.

Amadith, es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y se dedica a la Venta de Repuestos asociados en un negocio familiar juntamente con su esposo e hijo mayor. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00 y poco a poco fue implementando y ampliando mejor su negocio,  vio que le iba muy bien.

En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes de su barrio y de otros lugares, sus principales clientes son motocarristas y choferes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, comprará más repuestos como focos y faros de luz y tubos de escape para diversos tipos de movilidad, barras telescópicas para motos, llantas.
 
Amadith, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente motivada por hacer realidad  lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Amadith belongs to the Picota Communal Bank in the Picota district, Picota province, San Martín department. She is 48 and in a common law marriage. All of her children are now independent. Amadith is a woman who likes to work. She sells replacement parts in a family business with her husband and oldest son. She started with 300 PEN. Little by little she was setting up and expanding her business. She saw that it was going very well. She currently continues with the same business. She is well known by her customers in the neighborhood and from other places. Her main customers are drivers. With this loan for 2,500 PEN she will buy replacement parts like headlights and exhaust pipes for a variety of vehicles, telescopic rods for motorcycles, and tires. Amadith has many goals in front of her. She is motivated to make them become a reality. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her when she most needed it. She is responsible with her payments, and she plans on continuing in the same manner.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts to increase her stock

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
La señora Anita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Picota”, Distrito de Picota, Provincia de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 50 años y es madre de 07 hijos,  02 que aun depende de ella.

Anita, decidió vender sus comidas preparadas, en un local  muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa, ella nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados. Sus principales clientes choferes y moradores. 

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, vende en las mañanas de 8:00 am a 2:00 pm. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,200.00 comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos de papa, pollos desvicerados, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Anita, se siente muy bien y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propia tienda de abarrotes, bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.

loans.use: Comprará insumos, para preparar sus alimentos.

loans.name: Genecith

texts.es:
La señora Genecith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Picota”, Distrito de Picota, Provincia de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 37 años y 03 hijos, 03 que aun dependen de ella. 

Genecith es una mujer muy trabajadora, decidió emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque en ella tiene todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Genecith, se siente con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando y muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Mrs.Genecith belongs to the communal bank of Picota, District of Picota, Province of Picota, and Department of San Martin. She lives with her significant other. She is thirty seven years old and has three dependant children. Genecith is a very hard working woman who decided to begin her own business selling groceries, and with the earnings she’ll increase the economic earnings in her home. Now she has fixed clientele that come to her store daily to make purchases because she has all the products a housekeeper needs. She also personally deals with all her clients using her natural charisma. With the loan of $1,025 USD she will purchase rice and sugar in sacks; crackers, noodles and salt in packages; milk and preserved fish in boxes along with a variety of brands, eggs and articles of personal hygiene to continue giving the best service to her clients. Genecith wants very much to continue working and is very thankful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for their support of women like her and the opportunity to develop and move into the middle class.

Translated from Spanish by Tess Siemer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchace Groceries to Increase Stock

loans.name: Bernita

texts.es:
La señora Bernita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Picota”, Distrito de Picota, Provincia de Picota, Departamento de San Martín. Está Casada, tiene 50 años, y es madre de 03 hijos, 02 que aun están bajo su poder y están estudiando.

Su fuerza  y anhelo de sacar adelante a sus hijos, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa, un ambiente muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. 

Las ganancias que genera a diario le ayuda a mejorar el ingreso económico de su familia. Desde su inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes y hoy en la actualidad tiene clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su puesto a comprar porque ella  tiene todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad y carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00, comprará sacos de arroz y azúcar, fideos, sal y aceite en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Bernita, se siente muy bien, para continuar trabajando y se prepara día a día para asumir los retos  que la vida le presenta y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bernita, belongs to the Communal Bank “Picota,” Picota district, Picota province, San Martín department. She is 50 years old and married, a mother of 3 children, of which 2 still live with her and are attending school.

Her strength and determination to give her children a better future motivated her to start her own business by selling groceries. The store is located in her home, an environment that is very well set up to take care of her customers.

The profits that she makes daily help her improve the economic revenue of her family. Since the beginning up to today she has earned many recurring customers who daily go to her store as she has all the products that a housewife needs and she personally takes care of each customer with the kindness and enthusiasm that characterizes her.

With this loan of S/ 2,500.00, she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, spaghettis, salt and oil in packets, milk and boxes of canned fish in a variety of brands, eggs, and articles of personal hygiene in order to continue giving the best service to her customers.

Bernita feels very happy to continue working and prepares for each day to deal with the challenges that life presents. She gives thanks to Movimiento Manuela Ramos (Kiva’s field partner) for helping women like her have the opportunity to develop in whatever means they use to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries to increase her product stock.

loans.name: Ana Gladys

texts.es: Ana Gladys C. C. vive en San Luis La Herradura en el departamento de La Paz. Ana tiene 40 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos menores de edad quienes se encuentran estudiando. Ana posee un negocio venta de mariscos los cuales compra a muy buenos precios por encontrarse en una zona costera,  esto le permite a Ana obtener mayores ganancias por sus mariscos, ya que muchas personas viajan hasta San Luis La Herradura para compra maricos de calidad y a precios más bajos que en la capital, Ana solicita este crédito porque desea aumentar su inventario de sus mariscos.
texts.en:
Ana Gladys C. C. lives in San Luis La Herradura in the La Paz region. Ana is 40 years old, and lives with her husband and her two minor children who are in school. Ana has a business selling seafood, which she purchases at very good prices in the coastal zone. This allows Ana to obtain higher earnings from her seafood, given that many people visit San Luis La Herradura to buy high quality seafood at lower prices than are found in the capital. Ana is requesting this loan because she wishes to increase her inventory of seafood.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase her inventory of seafood

loans.name: Dibor

texts.fr: Dibor D. est une dame mariée de 60 ans et mère de 6 enfants. Elle fait un commerce de mil, maïs et arachide. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie familiale.
texts.en:
