Es convivente, tiene 36 años, tiene 02 hijos  que aun dependen de ella y están en estudios secundarios.Es poseedora de un gran fortaleza y un gran espíritu de superación, la necesidad de generar mas ingresos en casa, para tener una mejor calidad de vida y apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios le motivaron a iniciarse en la venta de comida y golosinas, la facilidad que tiene para desenvolverse en el negocio le ha permitido hacer crecer su kiosco que tiene en uno de los colegios de la ciudad. En la actualidad tiene una clientela fija que son los alumnos y profesores por que ven que los productos que ella ofrece son de muy buena calidad y  son atendidos con amabilidad que es lo que a ella le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará golosinas y productos necesarios para vender comida como: chocolates en cajas, gaseosas de diversos sabores, marcas y tamaños, leche tarros grandes y pequeños,  frugos, galletas, papa, arroz, carnes rojas por kilos, platos desechables y  entre otros. V., quiere tener surtido su kiosco, para que sus clientes encuentren lo que necesiten. V., se siente con muchas ganas  de seguir trabajando, y  aportando en su hogar, esta muy contenta y agradecida con la labor y el apoyo que recibe del Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse y de esta manera a apoyar a la realización de sus sueños y metas.

loans.use: Comprará insumos, para preparar sus comidas.

loans.name: Mahboba Group

texts.en:
Mahboba wants to take out a loan for her husband’s bookstore. He wants to enlarge his shop. Samya wants to take out a loan for her tailoring business. She wants to buy a new machine for her business. Rona wants to take out a loan for her son’s electric supplies business. Sedeqa wants to take out a loan for her quilting business. A. Hasham wants to take out a loan for his general store.

There are five members in the Mahboba Group. They want to improve and develop their businesses and have requested a group loan of 50,000 afghani.

loans.use: For enlarging their businesses

loans.name: Mahrabadine Group

texts.en:
MahrabaD. is the group leader of this group. The five members of this group all want to expand their businesses.

MahrabaD. wants to take a loan for his business of selling oil.

Khalely A. wants to take a loan is for his general store.

Maryna wants to take a loan for her carpet-weaving business.

AmraD. wants to take a loan for his general store.

AmalleD. wants to take a loan for his retail food business.

They have requested a group loan of 70,000 Afghani. The group sends many thanks to Kiva lenders for supporting entrepreneurs around the world.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital

loans.name: Shayma Gull

texts.en: Shayma Gull lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married but she lives alone in Kabul since all her family is living in anther province in Afghanistan. She came to Kabul to work hard for her family and opened a retail shop. She is new in her business and she wants to expand it. She wants to take an individual loan to complete her stock and make a better monthly income so that she can bring her family to the capital and help them better. She is happy that she can further her business by taking a small loan.

loans.use: they are improve their business

loans.name: Emma

texts.es:
Emma tiene 50 años, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos, quienes ya son independientes y viven fuera de casa, en la actualidad ella vive sola en su casa propia. Desde que tenía 10 años se ha dedicado a vender frutas y verduras regionales en un puesto del mercado que está a 30 minutos de su casa. Para adquirir estos productos frescos y de buena calidad tiene que levantarse muy temprano para comprarles a los agricultores que llegan a los puertos fluviales de su ciudad. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que la mantiene activa y libre de los problemas económicos, además a Emma le gusta mucho vender y dar una buena atención a sus clientes. Por otro lado, le es muy rentable porque vende todos los días, durante todo el día y no tiene otros gastos más que para ella.
Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, aunque a veces surgen problemas con algunas personas de su grupo por falta de pago, en conjunto logran solucionarlos, por ello está contenta con su banco comunal. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más frutas y verduras para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Emma is 50 years old. She is a single mother. She has for children, who are independent and live outside the house. Now she lives alone in her own house. Since she was ten years old, she has sold regional fruits and vegetables in a market in a stall at a market that is 30 minutes from her house. In order to acquire these products fresh and in good quality, she has to wake up very early in order to buy them from the farmers who arrive at the river ports in her city. What she likes about her work is that it keeps her active and free from economic problems. In addition, Emma enjoys sales and paying attention to her clients. Furthermore, it’s very profitable because she sells everyday, all day, and her only expenses are for herself. This is her seventh loan with MFP. Even though problems come up with some members of her group because they miss payments, they work together to arrive at a solution. Because of this, she is happy with her communal bank. With the money that comes in, she will buy more fruits and vegetables to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in merchandise

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela tiene 54 años, es soltera, tiene 4 hijos; los 3 mayores ya trabajan y sólo tiene bajo su responsabilidad a su hija menor de 10 años. Todos habitan juntos en su casa propia. Desde hace 23 años se dedica a la venta de frutas y chupetes de fruta en su domicilio. Las frutas que generalmente ofrece son: sandias, naranjas y plátanos, además vende cerca de 250 chupetes de fruta y hielo diarios. Anteriormente, Graciela vendía estos productos en un mercado, pero a causa de una enfermedad tuvo que dejar su puesto, pero una vez repuesta inició su negocio en su casa, de lo que no se arrepiente, pues también obtiene buenas ganancias, debido a que su casa se encuentra ubicada en una zona muy transitada de su ciudad y cuando le sobran algunos productos los acomoda en una bandeja y los vende de forma ambulante. Graciela quiere para el futuro tener una tienda de comestibles donde pueda vender más cómodamente.
Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, a ella le agrada mucho su banco comunal porque sus compañeros son personas buenas y trabajan en unión para el progreso de todo el grupo. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más frutas y también materiales de construcción para seguir mejorando la estructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Graciela is 54 and single. She has four children. The three oldest now work. Her ten year old daughter is the only one she is still responsible for. They all live together in their own house. For 23 years she has been selling fruits and fruit popsicles in her house. The fruits that she generally sells are watermelon, oranges, and bananas. Also, she sells close to 250 fruit popsicles a day. Previously, Graciela sold these products in a market. Due to an illness, she had to leave her stall. Once she was better, she started her business in her house. She does not regret it. She gets good earnings due to the fact that her house is located in a very busy part of the city. When there are left over products, she puts them on a tray and sells them on the street. In the future Graciela would like to have a grocery store where she could sell more comfortably. This is her second loan with MFP. She really likes her communal bank because her colleagues are good people, and they work together for progress for the whole group. She will use the money she is asking for to buy more fruit. She will also buy construction materials to keep improving the structure of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 45 años, es soltera, vive con su hermano que también es soltero y una de sus hermanas que es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos. Ella es propietaria de 2 motocarros, los mismos que compró con préstamos de MFP, uno de ellos es manejado por su hermano, quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros y para el otro contratan a un chofer. Esto vehículos los tiene desde hace 4 años, trabajan desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche y quien administra las ganancias de ambos es Juana. Adicionalmente, desde hace un año, ella se dedica a brindar el servicio de almuerzo a los trabajadores de una empresa constructora, pues tiene muy buena sazón y le gusta mucho cocinar. Para el futuro, Juana quiere tener una flota de motocarros, contratar a choferes e iniciar una empresa de transportes, así brindaría trabajo al que lo necesite. 
Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su grupo es que todos son organizados y se apoyan entre sí, su banco comunal se llama “Aguaytía”, que es el nombre de una localidad de su región. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará un motor y repuestos para hacer funcionar otro motocarro que se encuentra inactivo, con éste, ya tendría 3 para trabajar en transporte de pasajeros.
texts.en:
Juana is 45-years-old and single. She lives with her brother, who is also single, and one of her sisters, a single mother with two children. She owns two moto-taxis that she bought with MFP loans. One is driven by her brother, who earns his living taxiing people, and the other is rented out to a driver. Juana has had the vehicles, which are in use from 6 in the morning until 9 at night, for four years, and she manages their profits. In addition, for the past year she has provided lunches to workers in a construction company; she really likes to cook and she's very good at it. In the future, Juana wants to have a fleet of moto-taxis, rent them out to drivers, and start a transportation company, which would give jobs to those who need them. This will be Juana's seventh loan with MFP, and what she likes about her group is that they're all organized and supportive of each other. Her village bank is called "Aguaytía," which is the name of a town in the region. Juana plans to use her loan to buy a motor and spare parts to fix up another moto-taxi that isn't being used. Then she'll have three for taxiing passengers.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motor and spare parts for a moto-taxi.

loans.name: Libia

texts.es:
Libia tiene 34 años, es soltera, tiene un hijo de 8 años y vive también en compañía de su madre. En su casa tiene un pequeño local donde por las mañanas vende jugos y sándwich, y por las noches porciones de pollo frito o a la brasa, además de bebidas (gaseosas y refrescos). Para este negocio cuenta con el apoyo de su madre, quien es la encargada de atender a los clientes y Libia de preparar los platillos. En este trabajo tiene un periodo de 2 años y lo que más le gusta es la atención al público, además de mantenerse ocupada. También le es muy rentable porque se encuentra en un buen lugar, cercano a dos complejos deportivos muy concurridos, por lo que siempre hay personas transitando por esa zona. Su deseo a futuro es lograr tener un restaurante especializado en la venta de platos a base de pollo a la brasa y papas fritas, llamado “pollería”.
Este es su 2do crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que hay compañerismo y responsabilidad en todos los integrantes. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en su negocio, con la compra de ingredientes para sus platillos, bebidas, entre otras cosas más.

loans.use: Incremento de capital de inversión para su negocio

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 59 años, es madre de 5 hijos varones que ya son mayores de edad y trabajan, vive junto a su esposo, quien trabaja brindando servicio de transporte de pasajeros. Ella es dueña de tres motocarros, pero al mismo tiempo se dedica a la venta de comida, por las noches, en la puerta de su casa desde hace 2 años y cuenta con el apoyo de uno de sus hijos para esta actividad. Su esposo y sus dos hijos mayores son quienes manejan los motocarros y se dedican al transporte de pasajeros, son los encargados cuidar y mantener estos vehículos en buen estado, mientras María es responsable de la administración de las ganancias. El más antiguo de sus motocarros tiene 8 años de uso, el segundo 6 años y el último, 6 meses. Ella trabaja medio tiempo vendiendo comida para mantenerse ocupada, pero sus motocarros laboran  todo el día, por lo que este negocio familiar es muy rentable.
Este es su 3er crédito con MFP, ella es parte de un banco comunal y lo que le gusta de su grupo es que todos son muy coordinados, trabajan bien y se muestran confianza entre todos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará repuestos para mandar a reparar y hacer un mantenimiento mecánico a sus motocarros.

loans.use: Reparación de sus motocarros

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional merchandise to resell

loans.name: Alda

texts.en:
Alda A. makes a living primarily from planting and harvesting banana to sell. She is 47 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Alda has been in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Alda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Alda is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding an agricultural business

loans.name: Mrs. Sim Touch Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is for twenty people located in Boeng Káek village in Kandal province.  All the members will use the loan for different purposes.  Mrs. Sim Touch is the village bank president. She is a housewife. Her husband, Mr. Mat Met, is a farmer who owns a piece of land which he uses to cultivate rice to earn a living.  On this plantation, he faces an obstacle because his field is infertile, which has a bad effect on his crop.  In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Sim Touch decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field and make the crop more productive.  She is 52-years-old and the mother of eight children. Three of her children are employed in a garment factory, another is a construction worker, three are attending the local school, and the youngest one is too young to work or study. 

Six members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support the field to make the crop more productive.

loans.name: Lailane

texts.en:
Lailane T. is from the village of Maquilao, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old. Lailane is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Lailane owns & operates a business raising fish for sale. Lailane has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Lailane joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lailane is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lailane from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Mary-Ann

texts.en:
Mary-Ann retails fish in their village for almost two years. She diligently walks around their village carrying her large and heavy Styrofoam container to sell her fish.  She is glad that she can earn a daily net income of PHP500 through her diligence in selling in their neighborhood.  As a parent, she always wanted to provide the needs of her children through her business.  She believes that by working hard she could also uplift the poor living condition of her family. 

Mary-Ann is hoping to borrow a loan of PHP4, 000 from the KIVA lenders.  She will use the loan to use as additional capital for her business to become productive.  She plans to purchase bigger volume of fish to increase her merchandise and so with her income.  She is hoping that her loan will be granted for it will greatly help her not only in the business but also in providing the needs of their family.  

Mary-Ann is already 40 years old and a diligent business woman from the village of Arcon, Tumauini, Isabela. Her husband Artemio is working as a farmer and a passenger tricycle driver which is owned by their neighbor.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy farming supplies to support her growing.

texts.en: Amy A. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin. She is 30 years old, is married, and has four infant children. Amy owns and operates a business providing manicure and pedicure services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Amy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Amy is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. loans.name: Maris Stella

texts.en: Maris Stella A. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 23 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Maris Stella owns and operates a sari-sari or general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Maris Stella joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Maris Stella is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is engaged in selling iced candy. She sells different flavors of iced candies in their village in Arcon Tumauini, Isabela, by going from one house to another. Aside from this, she also sells barbecue sticks in the afternoon in order to have an additional source of income.

Josie also dreams of having a stable business someday so that she can continue to assist her husband in providing for the needs of their family. At present, she would like to request a loan of PHP 4,000 that she needs as additional capital in her business. This amount will be of great help to make her business grow.

Josie is 43 years old and married to Romeo, a factory worker. They are blessed with four children and she is hoping to provide them with the complete education that they need to succeed in life.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita C., the 41-year-old mother of five children, is a food vendor. Her eldest is just 16 and all of them are studying in school. She is a widow. She dreams of growing her livelihood more to help support the education of her children.

Juanita would like to apply for a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). She will use the loan to buy additional ingredients for food that she cooks and sells. The income she makes from selling food helps a lot in covering the daily expenses in their home.

Juanita joined CEVI’s micro-credit program in 2007. She said she likes its services because it has only a 2% interest rate which is lower and more affordable to repay.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Mom Sorn Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank group consists of eleven people who all live in Sdao Kanleng village in Kandal province. Mrs. Srey Mom S. is the village bank president selected by the members. She is a housewife and her husband, Mr. Sim Roeun, is a construction worker. Although her husband works hard, he still does not earn sufficient income and now faces the problem of not owning a source of fresh water for his family to access. Thus, Mrs. Srey Mom S. has decided to ask for a loan to dig a well for her family’s use. She is 29 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is enrolled in a local school.

loans.use: To dig a well for her family’s use

loans.name: Luz

texts.en: Luz C. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 30 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Luz owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Luz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda D. started raising hogs more than a decade ago, to help with the family finances and send her children to school. Being a mother of three children, she had to work hard to grow her business to provide for her family's needs and help pay the school fees. 
With her membership in CEVI last year, she was able to purchase hog supplements to continue raising hogs. She hopes to receive a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy supplements for her hogs. Erlinda says that the income she makes helps her family in many ways, especially with her children’s tuition fees.

loans.use: To buy hog feed

loans.name: Bebie Rose

texts.en:
Bebie Rose R. is from the village of Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 37,married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Bebie Rose owns & operates a business venture making & selling barbecued pork and chicken in the market. Bebie Rose has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Bebie Rose joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bebie Rose repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC, and is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which she will use to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Bebie Rose from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Mrs. Sopheap Rours Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank group consists of 15 people who live in Samraong village in Kandal province. All the members will use their loans for different purposes. Mrs. Sopheap R. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. She faces a problem because she does not have rice seed to plant in her paddyfield. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed. Her husband, Mr. Kong Vanna, is a motorbike taxi driver. Mrs. Sopheap R. is 44 years old and the mother of three children, all of whom attend the local school.

Eight members in this group have end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those who have EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. EoT loans are AMK’s main product because they are most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These loans allows the borrower to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy rice seed

loans.name: San

texts.en: San K. is a single mother, as she is divorced; she has 5 children, two are single and the other 3 are married and live away from home.  She is 49 and lives in Sam Reap Province, the best territory for tourism. One of her sons, Chorn Vanna, 26, drives a motor taxi for a profit, and is shown in the photo. San K. sells food to students who study in the local secondary school. She requests a loan to enlarge her business in order to gain more valued customers. She will use her loan to buy extra essential ingredients and some attractive furniture.

loans.use: To buy extra essential ingredients and some attractive furniture

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia I. is from the village of Mambajao,  Camiguin. She is 35, married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Sonia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, where she sells food & daily use products to the local community. Sonia has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Sonia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sonia is 4000 PHP, which she will use to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Sonia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren L. owns a 2-hectare rice field that he tills because it is his only source of income for his family. Now that his family needs more support for food, clothing and other basic needs, the income that he makes from growing rice is not enough. He is skillful in raising hogs, so he was encouraged to start a small piggery to supplement their income. 

In August 2008 he heard that CEV offers low interest rate, which is quite interesting and beneficial for business starts. So he decided to be a member of a cluster organization and used his 1st loan for hog supplements and also for some financing needs. 

Now, he is applying for a loan of Php 10,000.00 so he could buy feed for his hogs.

loans.use: Hog Feed

loans.name: Luz Rene

texts.en: Mrs. Luz Rene I. is like any mother who wants her children sent to school to have a proper education. She has three children and her eldest is 17 years old. Luz owns a one-hectare rice field and manages three heads of pigs for fattening. She had the opportunity to join CEVI a year ago. Like other members of CEVI, she found its program helpful because of the low interest rate. She applied for a loan of Php 12,000.00 to be used for farming needs.

loans.use: Farming needs

loans.name: Nanette

texts.en:
Nanette L. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin. She is 27 years old. Nanette is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Nanette owns & operates a business providing multicab services for transporting passengers in the local community. Nanette has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nanette joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nanette is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services she provides. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nanette from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice makes a living through her business of buying used bottles and cans that she sells in the junk shops. She has been in this kind of business for more than two years. She is proud of her business and she believes that as long as she can provide her five children with their daily needs there is nothing she should be ashamed of with her business. 

She hopes that she will make her business more profitable, so she is requesting a loan of PHP5,000.00 from KIVA lenders to have additional capital.  The loan will be used to buy recyclable materials like cans, empty bottle, steel, plastics and other aluminum products that she will sell later on.  

Eunice is married to Eulgenio, a farmer.  They have five children: three of them are already studying. They live peacefully in the village of Arcon Tumauini, Isabela.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Albert

texts.en: Albert H., a father of a 2-year-old, sustains his family by raising pigs and disposes it after 2 months. He also owns a Sari-Sari store and 2 hectares of rice field given by his parents. He sees CEV as a blessing to him and other farmers who desires to start a business but lacks capital for starting. Out of his loan from CEV, he was not just able to finance for his farm, but he managed to buy a piglet to for businessexpansion. For his applied loan of Php 4, 000.00, Albert plans to buy farming needs and feeds for his hogs.

loans.use: Feeds and Farm Financing

loans.name: Morng

texts.en: Mrs. Morng L., 53, is a single mother blessed with six children. Two of them are married and live in separate homes, while the other four work at different jobs. Two are garment workers and two are silk weavers. Morng L. is married, but her husband died of senility years ago. Since 1990, Morng L. has been weaving silk, a skill she learned from her grandmother. She sells her finished product to a middleman, who then takes it to resell at the market. She has also been hired by the villagers to spin silk where she can earn extra income. Morng L. will use her loan to buy a motorcycle for her unemployed son to begin a taxi service and the rest of the loan she will use to purchase silk threads for braiding.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie P. is 48 years old and a resident of Antipolo City, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is married to Nolito who is 46 and her business partner. She is a mother to Rolly who is 23 years old and a high school graduate. Rosemarie and her husband are partners in their resale business. They resell fish and vegetables. They have been doing the business for six years already and they are happy in their resale business since it brings them back good proceeds. They buy fish from the fishermen and sell it in the village and in the market. The same with vegetables. They buy vegetables direct from the farmers and sell it in their community.

In 2006, she decided to join ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines with the intention to have access to capital to improve her business. Her previous loans were carefully used as rolling capital for her resale business. Now on her sixth loan, she proposes a loan of 20,000 pesos as additional capital for her business. To breakdown, 15,000 pesos will be rolling capital for the resale of fish and 5,000 pesos will be the rolling capital in the resale of vegetable.

She is hopeful that with the help of ASHI and the trust of KIVA, she can improve her business. She dreams of having a house and a lot.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 44 years old and married to Manuel, a truck driver. They are blessed with six children, three of whom are still studying. Their family lives in the village of Arcon Tumauini, Isabela which is located along the national highway and farming is the common source of income of the residents.  

Lourdes manages a small business located in the public market of Tumauini. She sells different dry goods like toys, accessories, personal necessities and some farm inputs that she sells at lower prices.  She also offers services like manicure and hair cutting in her stall for additional income.  She hopes that she will be able to have additional capital that she can use to purchase more fertilizer to increase her income.  Her retail business is very beneficial to her family so she always wants to expand her business.  With this, she wants a loan amounting to PHP4,000 that will help her to maintain and to expand her current business.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Chai

texts.en: The two persons shown in the picture over are Chai K. and her husband. Chai K. owns a store on which she sells a few grocery items to her neighbors and passer-by as well. She usually buys produce in bulk from a marker supplier to resell at gaining income. Normally, she can make average income of $3.50 per day. She has been running his business since early 2002. Her husband, Douk, age 23, who helps her with the business, and who is a local farmer. This young couple now has one young child who attends school. Chai K.'s investment is main source of income for the family and she recently sold all of the produce in her store. Therefore, she would like to ask for a loan to accumulate a larger number of groceries to resell.

loans.use: To accumulate a larger number of groceries to resell

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie A. is from the village of Migcanaway, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 19 years old. Margie is single and has two infant children. To make a living, Margie owns & operates a business raising fish for sale. Margie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Margie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Margie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is a mother full of hopes and dreams for her children.  She aims to give her two children a complete education for them to become successful in the future.  She is now 41 years old and very determined to work hard for her family while she is still strong and capable of doing a business.  She is married to Noel and they live in the village of Arcon Tumauini, Isabela. Their children are: Christine and Clifford Darryl, they are both in the high school level.  

Tita sells ice candy flavored buko (coconut) in their village.  She can produce 800 -1,000 pieces of ice candy and sell it for PHP5.00 each. With her business, she can also help other residents by helping her to sell her products and they can earn PHP1.00 for every piece ice candy that they can sell.  She hopes to produce more ice candy to increase daily income of PHP500 and able to provide the educational needs of their children. By having additional capital, she believes that her business will further expand and will be more profitable. That is why she is requesting to avail a loan amounting to PHP5, 000 from KIVA lenders.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nueva Flor”  que esta ubicado de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 25 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 01 hijo y tiene estudios de secundaria completa, vive en el centro poblado de Ocoña.

La señora trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 01 año,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado mayor y menor para engorde, y venderlo luego de su asimilación en 4 a 5 meses, en las ferias de la zona.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando para poder educar a su hijo.

A ella le gustan las facilidades de pago y sus bajos intereses
texts.en:
Mercedes belongs to the "Nueva Flor" ("New Flower") Community Bank in the district of Ilave, El Collao province, in the Puno region. She is 25 years old, married and the mother of one son, has completed her secondary education and lives in the town of Ocoña. Mercedes has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for almost a year now, having received an initial loan of 500 PEN to buy small livestock. She is now asking for a loan of 1000 PEN to purchase small and large livestock for fattening, to be sold on at local markets after a 4-5 month period of development. Her greatest wish is to continue working and so be able to educate her son. She appreciates the ease of repayment and low interest rates.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Clapham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina B. started to manage a store to support her husband raise their family. The income she makes from selling helped a lot in buying food and paying the daily costs in their home. Her dream is to have a grocery store someday so that she could be able to sell more and earn bigger profit.

She has looking for an opportunty to grow her business more. That is why she wanted to apply for a loan of Php 12,000 to buy additional merchandise to resell. In this way, she will be able to offer more variety of goods to her customers while earning nigger income in her business.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise to resell

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona has owned a variety store in her village for ten years, selling products such as foams, casserole dishes, mosquito nets, towels, and appliances such as electric fans. Her customers buy on credit, paying her in installments. Her capital is insufficient to meet customer demand, so Alona is requesting a loan of PHP5,000.00 to help her purchase more products including towels, casserole dishes, and other household items. She hopes that through the loan, her business will become more profitable.

Alona is 37 years old and married to Joel. They have two children who are both studying, and they live happily in the village of Arcon, Tumauini, Isabela.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Yola

texts.es:
La señora Yola pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nueva Flor”  que esta ubicado de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 28 años de edad, estado civil soltera y es madre de 03 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria incompleta 4to grado, vive en el Barrio Nueva Esperanza Jr. Altiplano 450.

La señora trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 03 años,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de pescado. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de pescado y algunos ovinos para la venta en las ferias semanales.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando.

A ella le gustan las facilidades de pago  y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Yola belongs to the "Nueva Flor" ("New Flower") Community Bank in the district of Ilave, El Collao province, in the Puno region. She is 28 years old, unmarried and the mother of 3 children, reached 4th grade in her secondary education and lives in the Nueva Esperanza Jr. Altiplano 450 neighbourhood. Yola has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for 3 years now, having received an initial loan of 300 PEN to buy fish. She is now asking for a loan of 500 PEN to purchase fish and a few sheep to sell at weekly markets. Her greatest wish is to continue working. She appreciates the ease of repayment and savings.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Clapham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sheep and fish.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor Huancarani”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Cruz Pata del distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 60 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 03 hijos, La señora Maria, estudio educación primaria incompleta (3ro grado), vive en la Comunidad de Cruz Pata.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invirtió comprando ganado ovino. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de ganado ovino, para engorde y cría.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan las  reuniones y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the “Flor Huancarani” Community Bank in Cruz Pata in the Juli district of Chucuito province, in the Puno region. She is 60 years old, is married and has 3 children. She reached 3rd grade in her primary education and lives in the Cruz Pata neighbourhood. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for 3 years, having received an initial loan of 300 PEN which she used to purchase sheep. She is now asking for a loan of 1000 PEN to buy sheep for fattening and breeding. Her wish is to continue working. She appreciates the meetings and punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Clapham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sheep.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora Elena es socia del Banco Comunal “Dante Nava”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 47 años de edad, estado civil soltera y es madre de 01 hijo, La señora Elena estudio educación superior (profesora de primaria), vive en Jr. Velasco Astete 325.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace varios años es una de las socias fundadoras,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que invirtió en la recuperación de su casa. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de arroz, papas, fideos, verduras, etc. Para la preparación de comida, y vender para sacar ganancias para poder recuperar su casa ya que su hermano lo dio en garantía y no pago la señora con su trabajo y con el apoyo de Manuela Ramos luego de 7 años logro recuperarla, ahora trabaja para poder mejorar la educación y alimentación de sus hijos.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando para salir adelante.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos, y esta agradecida a Manuela Ramos por todo su apoyo para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Elena is a member of the "Dante Nava" Community Bank in the district, province and region of Puno. She is 47 years old, is fundamental unmarried and has one child. Elena is a qualified primary school teacher and lives in Jr. Velasco Astete 325. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for some years now and is one of the founding members. She used her initial loan of 300 PEN to recover her house. She is now asking for a loan of 1000 PEN to buy rice, potatoes, pasta, vegetables and other ingredients to prepare food to sell. Her aim is to use the profits to recover her house, which her brother used as collateral but failed to make his payments. After 7 years of work, with the support of Manuela Ramos, Elena managed to recover the property, and is now working to improve her children's education and nutrition. Her wish is to continue working and making progress. She appreciates the loan repayment facilities and is thankful to Manuela Ramos for all its support in achieving a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Clapham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, potatoes, pasta, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 50, vive con su esposo, quien es maestro constructor, y con sus 3 hijos que ya son mayores de edad y trabajan. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos, los cuales vende ambulatoriamente por la zona donde vive y también viaja a algunos caseríos de su región dejando sus productos al contado o al crédito. Ella trabaja con su esposo, quien es el encargado de abastecer la mercadería, para ello él viaja frecuentemente a la ciudad donde compra las prendas a menores precios. Lo que le gusta a Carmen de su trabajo es que conoce muchos lugares, además le es rentable porque ya cuenta con clientes que le hacen pedidos regularmente. Por otro lado, también vende chupetes de fruta y hielo en su casa, negocio que emprendió hace 4 meses. Con todas estas actividades, planea ir mejorando sus ingresos económicos, pues para el futuro le gustaría tener una tienda de ropa.
Este es su décimo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de ser parte de un banco comuna es que todos los integrantes son unidos y responsables en sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora viene solicitando, Carmen comprará más ropa y zapatos, además de empezar la construcción de un pequeño local para implementar su tienda de ropa en el futuro.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Vith

texts.en:
C., 26, is a general doctor who learned his skills in a private school.  He owns a small clinic in his home where he sells medicine and examines patients who live nearby.  Married to Sopeap, a 24-year-old hairdresser, they are blessed with one young child who is not yet enrolled in school. Because Sopeap does not have her own salon shop, C. is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva through HKL to be used to build one, with the remainder being used to meet some of the requirements for his clinic. 

Note: C.'s wife is shown in the photo.

loans.use: To build a beauty salon shop and meet some of the requirements for his clinic.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
César tiene 46 años, es padre dos preciosas niñas que están estudiando y vive con su esposa quien lo apoya en todo. Desde hace 4 años se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, anteriormente trabajaba vendiendo madera, pero debido a una operación al hígado, el médico le recomendó tener una vida muy activa. Por tal motivo, ser chofer de un motocarro es un trabajo adecuado para él y gracias a su esfuerzo diario, logró comprar su propio motocarro hace 2 años, en el cual viene trabajando. Lo que más le gusta a César de su actividad es relacionarse con muchas personas y conversar durante el recorrido, también le es muy rentable porque trabaja todo el día y como ya no tiene que pagar un alquiler del vehículo, todas sus ganancias son directamente para su familia.
Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, él se ha integrado a un banco comunal y lo que más le gusta de su grupo es que sus compañeros son personas responsables y muy generosas. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará repuestos para la reparación y mantenimiento de su motocarro.

loans.use: Compra de repuestos para su motocarro
